SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/set-runowner-desktopflowconnection.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "properties": { "environment": { "id": "/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/environments/[ENVIRONMENT_ID]", "name":"[ENVIRONMENT_ID]" }, "displayName": "[DISPLAY_NAME]", "credentialId": "[CREDENTIAL_ID]", "connectionParametersSet": { "name":"azureRelayRunOwner", "values": { "username":{"value":"@environmentVariables(\"[ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_USERNAME]\")"}, "password":{"value":"none"}, "targetId":{"value":"[GROUP_ID]"}, "tokenRunOwnerCert:clientId":{"value":"[APP_ID]"}, "tokenRunOwnerCert:clientCertificateSecret": { "value": { "pfx":"[PFX]", "password":"[PASSWORD]" } } } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing UI Strings in Power Automate Widget using GET_STRINGS Event DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript example demonstrates how to customize UI text within the Power Automate widget. The host listens for the 'GET_STRINGS' event. In the callback, it uses `widgetDoneCallback` to pass a JSON object containing key-value pairs. The keys correspond to specific UI elements (like 'FLOW_CREATION_HEADER', 'INVOKE_FLOW_RUN_FLOW_BUTTON'), and the values are the custom strings to display. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/embed-flow-dev.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` widget.listen("GET_STRINGS", function(requestParam, widgetDoneCallback) { widgetDoneCallback(null, { "FLOW_CREATION_HEADER": "", "INVOKE_FLOW_RUN_FLOW_BUTTON": "" }); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interacting with SAP GUI Elements in VBScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to interact with SAP GUI elements using the session object. It demonstrates maximizing a window, entering text into input fields, and sending virtual key presses. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/reviewing-generated-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: VBScript CODE: ``` session.findById("wnd[0]").maximize session.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[0]/okcd").text = "PA30" session.findById("wnd[0]").sendVKey 0 session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/ctxtRP50G-PERNR").text = "EmployeeId" session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/tabsMENU_TABSTRIP/tabpTAB01/ssubSUBSCR_MENU:SAPMP50A:0400/subSUBSCR_TIME:SAPMP50A:0330/ctxtRP50G-BEGDA").text = "EffectiveDate" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding Default Business Process Flow Application in Dataverse DESCRIPTION: When creating a new table row, you can override the default business process flow application by setting the ProcessId column to either Guid.Empty (to skip applying a process) or to a specific business process flow table reference (to apply a specific process). SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/business-process-flows-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` // Set to Guid.Empty to skip setting a business process flow entity.Attributes["ProcessId"] = Guid.Empty; // OR set to a specific business process flow table reference entity.Attributes["ProcessId"] = new EntityReference("workflow", specificProcessId); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example SCM Sign In User Configuration for Quality Order RPA Solution DESCRIPTION: Shows an example username format for the 'SCM SignIn User' environment variable within the Dynamics 365 Quality Order RPA solution configuration. This variable defines the user account the automation process will use to sign into Dynamics 365 SCM. Users should replace this example email with the actual credentials for the designated automation account. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/dynamics365-scm-rpa.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` helloworld@contoso.com ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Datacenter Region URL Mapping Table DESCRIPTION: A markdown table showing the mapping between region codes and their corresponding Dynamics CRM URLs for configuring satellite environment variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/automation-kit/setup/faqs.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Region | URL | |------------|---------------------------| | Region | URL | | NAM | crm.dynamics.com | | DEU | crm.microsoftdynamics.de | | SAM | crm2.dynamics.com | | CAN | crm3.dynamics.com | | EUR | crm4.dynamics.com | | FRA | crm12.dynamics.com | | APJ | crm5.dynamics.com | | OCE | crm6.dynamics.com | | JPN | crm7.dynamics.com | | IND | crm8.dynamics.com | | GCC | crm9.dynamics.com | | GCC High | crm.microsoftdynamics.us | | GBR | crm11.dynamics.com | | ZAF | crm14.dynamics.com | | UAE | crm15.dynamics.com | | GER | crm16.dynamics.com | | CHE | crm17.dynamics.com | | CHN | crm.dynamics.cn | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Documenting Exception Handling in Exchange Message Processing - Markdown DESCRIPTION: This markdown table documents the specific exceptions that may be encountered when performing Exchange email message operations in Power Automate. Each entry explains the nature and trigger of the exception, helping users diagnose configuration or runtime errors. No prerequisites are required; users can reference this section for troubleshooting and error awareness. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/exchange.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` ### Exceptions |Exception|Description| |-----|-----| |Specified mail-folder doesn't exist|Indicates that the specified mail folder doesn't exist| |Failed to process email messages|Indicates a problem processing the specified email messages| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Validating Cloud Flow Naming Convention for Metering using RegEx DESCRIPTION: This Regular Expression (RegEx) pattern is used internally by the Automation Kit to validate the naming convention required for solution-aware cloud flows to be metered. Flows must end with '_AP-', followed by 9 digits, an underscore, 3 digits, and a word boundary (e.g., 'FlowName_AP-123456789_001'). This ensures flows adhere to the format '[CloudFlowName]_AP-[9digits]_[3digits]' for proper metering. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/automation-kit/limitations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: RegEx CODE: ``` _AP-[0-9]{9}_[0-9]{3}\\b ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling User Feedback Settings in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell commands referenced for Power Platform administrators to disable the disableSurveyFeedback tenant setting. This allows admins to prevent users from sending feedback to Microsoft. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/manage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` Set-TenantSettings List-TenantSettings ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Batch Signing Multiple DLL Files Using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell script that iterates through all DLL files in a specified folder and signs each one with the provided certificate. This is more efficient than manually signing each DLL file individually. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-custom-actions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` Get-ChildItem {the folder where dll files of custom module exist} -Filter *.dll | Foreach-Object { Signtool sign /f {your certificate name}.pfx /p {your password for exporting the certificate} /fd SHA256 $_.FullName } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Activity Duration to Case Duration Ratio DESCRIPTION: Calculates the average ratio of activity duration compared to total case duration using the CASE operator to switch context levels. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/custom-metrics-advanced-examples.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: process-mining-expression CODE: ``` AVG(EventsPerAttribute(), Duration() / CASE(Duration())) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Detecting Widget Readiness in Power Automate Widget with JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet shows how to use the 'widget.listen()' method to detect when the Power Automate widget has successfully initialized and is ready for interaction. The host application can listen for the 'WIDGET_READY' event and execute any necessary setup code or logic within the provided callback function. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/embed-flow-dev.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` widget.listen("WIDGET_READY", function() { console.log("The flow widget is now ready."); // other host code on widget ready }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Documenting Produced Variables for PDF Extraction - Markdown DESCRIPTION: This Markdown table outlines the output variables produced by extracting pages from a PDF in Power Automate. It lists variable names, types, and descriptions, supporting users in understanding the results of the extract operation. The documented variable, 'ExtractedPDF', refers to the newly created PDF file containing selected pages. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/pdf.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Argument|Type|Description|\n|-----|-----|-----|\n|ExtractedPDF|[File](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)|The new PDF file| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining ISFINISHED() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Checks if a case is categorized as finished according to the Process Context - Case Categorization. Supported in case context. Returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISFINISHED() Returns true when the case is categorized as finished (as defined in Process Context – Case Categorization). **Supported context:** case **Output Data Type**: BOOL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Conditional Statistical Calculation - STDEVIF Example DESCRIPTION: Calculates standard deviation of values meeting specified conditions within a context. Handles numerical and time-based data types. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/aggregations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Expression Language CODE: ``` STDEVIF([context],[condition],[value]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Work Queue Item JSON Structure DESCRIPTION: This JSON structure represents a sample work queue item for a vendor invoice. It includes fields such as InvoiceId, InvoiceDate, AccountName, Amount, and Status. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/work-queues-process.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "InvoiceId": "I-1006", "InvoiceDate": "06/04/2023", "AccountName": "Fabrikam", "ContactEmail": "invoicing@fabrikam.com", "Amount": 1253.78, "Status": "Paid", "WorkQueueKey": "Vendor Invoices", "ComponentState": 0, "OverwriteTime": "1900-01-01T00:00:00" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Power Automate Flow via Copilot based on Email Sender DESCRIPTION: This Copilot prompt directs Power Automate to create a flow triggered by incoming emails from the specific address 'jake@contoso.com'. When such an email is received, the flow sends a push notification to the user and updates the email's status to 'read'. Requires connections to Power Automate, email (like Outlook), and the push notification service. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/email-triggers.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` When I receive an email from jake@contoso.com, send me a push notification and mark the email as Read. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving the Previous Event's User Name using PREVIOUS() DESCRIPTION: Returns the 'userName' attribute value of the event immediately preceding the current event within the same case. If the current event is the first one in the case (i.e., there is no previous event), it returns the specified default value ("n/a"). This metric is applicable in metrics filters, implicitly operating within the case context. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/other-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: dsl CODE: ``` PREVIOUS(userName, "n/a") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Date Modification Functions DESCRIPTION: Functions for adding time units to existing dates or time intervals. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/date-and-time-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ADDDAYS([date],[count]) ADDHOURS([date],[count]) ADDMILLIS([date],[count]) ADDMINUTES([date],[count]) ADDMONTHS([date],[count]) ADDSECONDS([date],[count]) ADDYEARS([date],[count]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic FetchXML Query for Scheduled Flow Runs DESCRIPTION: A FetchXML query that counts the number of flow runs triggered by schedule in the last three days. The query filters on parent run ID being null, trigger type being 'Scheduled', and start time being greater than or equal to a specific date. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/automation-center-copilot.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Variables Produced Table - Markdown DESCRIPTION: Lists variables output by an action in a Markdown table, specifying their names, types, and descriptions for documentation clarity. This format is used to clarify what data (variables) is produced after execution. No dependencies are required, and table inputs are column-based: Argument, Type, Description. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/text.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` |Argument|Type|Description|\n|-----|-----|-----|\n|EscapedText|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|The escaped text| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Conditional Event Value Retrieval with MOVEIF Function DESCRIPTION: Returns the value of an event that satisfies a specific condition based on a given offset. Used for calculating metrics for events that meet certain criteria within a case. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/other-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` MOVEIF(3, userName == "Laura", eventCost, 0) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Selecting Non-Null Rows after Update (Row Exclusion) - SQL DESCRIPTION: Executes a SQL SELECT statement that retrieves only those rows from an Excel worksheet where specified columns contain non-null data. This pattern complements the recommended update-for-delete pattern: after setting a row's values to NULL, this statement filters them out in subsequent data processing. Requires an active SQL connection, correct replacements for worksheet and column names, and that column nullification has already been performed. Outputs all rows except those with entirely nullified values in the specified columns. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/sql-queries-excel.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: SQL CODE: ``` SELECT * FROM [SHEET$] WHERE [COLUMN1] IS NOT NULL OR [COLUMN2] IS NOT NULL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding the Next Event Matching a Condition using NEXTIF() DESCRIPTION: Searches for the first subsequent event within the same case that satisfies the specified condition (`userName == "Laura"`). If such an event is found, it returns the value of the specified attribute ('eventCost') for that event. If no subsequent event meets the condition, it returns the specified default value (0). Applicable in any custom metric context. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/other-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: dsl CODE: ``` NEXTIF(userName == "Laura", eventCost, 0) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Machine Registration to Any Tenant in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This registry entry allows machine registrations to any tenant in Power Automate. When set to 1, machines can register to any tenant without restrictions. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Registration\AllowRegisteringOutsideOfAADJoinedTenant ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restoring Multiple Deleted Flows using PowerShell Loop DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script demonstrates how to restore multiple soft-deleted flows in a single operation using a `foreach` loop. It iterates through a predefined array of `FlowName` GUIDs (e.g., "4d1f7648-ad60-4871-91cb-b77d7ef3c239", "eb2266a8-67b6-4919-8afd-f59c3c0e4131") and calls `Restore-AdminFlow` for each one within the specified environment ('Default-55abc7e5-2812-4d73-9d2f-8d9017f8c877'). A `Start-Sleep -Seconds 1` command introduces a one-second pause between each restore operation. Restored flows are initially disabled. Requires prior authentication, the environment name, and the list of flow GUIDs. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/how-tos-restore-deleted-flow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` foreach ($id in @( "4d1f7648-ad60-4871-91cb-b77d7ef3c239", "eb2266a8-67b6-4919-8afd-f59c3c0e4131" )) { Restore-AdminFlow -EnvironmentName Default-55abc7e5-2812-4d73-9d2f-8d9017f8c877 -FlowName $id; Start-Sleep -Seconds 1 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restricting Work/School and Organization Premium Account Sign-ins via Windows Registry - Registry DESCRIPTION: Disallows users from signing in with work, school, or organization premium accounts by setting 'RestrictOrgIDAccountsSignIns' (DWORD) to 1 at 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop' under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. This configuration requires elevated privileges; a value of 1 enforces blocking of OrgID-based account logins. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n\n[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Power Automate Desktop]\n"RestrictOrgIDAccountsSignIns"=dword:00000001\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Social Activity Table Error Scenario in Business Process Flows DESCRIPTION: A code reference highlighting the Social Activity table's limitation in business process flows, where users cannot save forms created through the Next Stage button, resulting in an 'Unexpected error' message. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/business-process-flows-overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` If you navigate to the business process flow stage that contains the `Social Activity` table and choose the **Next Stage** button, you'll see the **Create** option. When you choose **Create**, the **Social Activity** form loads. However, because `Social Activity` isn't valid for `Create` from the app user interface, you won't be able to save the form and you'll see the error message: "Unexpected error." ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using MINVALIF for Conditional Selection by Minimum Attribute in Power Automate Expressions (Pseudo-Expression Language) DESCRIPTION: MINVALIF selects an element with the lowest [value1] matching a condition, returning [value2] from that item. Parameters: [context], [condition] (boolean), [value1], [value2], [default] (fallback result). Output type varies by [value2]. Enables conditional, context-sensitive minimal-value selection in metrics. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/aggregations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: pseudo-expression CODE: ``` MINVALIF([context],[condition],[value1],[value2],[default]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Registering Plugin DLL - PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command registers the UI automation plugin DLL for use in Power Automate Desktop within a virtual desktop environment. It is often executed after unregistering the DLL to resolve plugin communication issues. Dependency: regsvr32 and correct permissions. Input: DLL file name; Output: Registers the DLL as a COM server. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/troubleshoot.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` regsvr32 .\\Microsoft.Flow.RPA.Desktop.UIAutomation.RDP.DVC.Plugin.dll ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Flow Definition Limits Table DESCRIPTION: Markdown table defining the technical limits for single flow definitions including actions, nesting depth, and variable constraints. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/limits-and-config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Name | Limit | Notes | | ---- | ----- | ----- | | Actions per workflow | 500 | Flows with a large number of actions might encounter performance issues while you edit them, even if they have fewer than 500. Consider using child flows to reduce the number of actions in a single flow or if you need more than 500. | | Allowed nesting depth for actions | 8 | Add child flows if you need more than eight levels of nesting. | | Switch scope cases limit | 25 | | | Variables per workflow | 250 | | | Length of `action` or `trigger` name | 80 characters | | | Characters per expression | 8,192 | | | Length of `description` | 256 characters | | | Maximum size of `trackedProperties` | 16,000 characters | | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining ISINCOMPLETEIMPORT() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Checks if a case is categorized as import incomplete according to the Process Context - Case Categorization. Supported in case context. Returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISINCOMPLETEIMPORT() Returns true when the case is categorized as import incomplete (as defined in Process Context – Case Categorization) **Supported context:** case **Output Data Type**: BOOL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Activating Verbose Logging State in Power Automate Desktop DESCRIPTION: This registry entry turns on the verbose logging state for Power Automate Desktop. When set to 1, verbose logging is activated for the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\UseVerboseLogging ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Correcting SQL Query Using Double Quotes for Variables in Power Automate (SQL) DESCRIPTION: This SQL snippet shows the corrected version of a query for use in Power Automate. By replacing single quotes with double quotes ("") around the variable placeholder '%value%', the query avoids syntax conflicts and allows Power Automate to correctly substitute the variable's value. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/troubleshoot-sql-queries.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` SELECT * FROM SALES WHERE VALUE = "%value%"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Get Credential Action Exceptions in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the possible exceptions that can occur when using the 'Get credential' action in Power Automate. It lists four types of exceptions related to credential retrieval failures, invalid configurations, timeouts, and vault contact issues. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/powerautomatesecretvariables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Exception|Description| |-----|-----| |Failed to get credential|Indicates a problem while retrieving the credential| |Invalid credentials configuration|Indicates that the credentials configuration is invalid| |Credential timed out|Indicates that the request timed out| |Failed to contact credentials vault|Indicates that there was a failure in contacting the credentials vault| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Java Agent and Library Path at Java Application Startup - Shell DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides the required arguments for launching a Java application with Power Automate Desktop\'s Java automation agent. Depending on the system architecture (64-bit or 32-bit Java), you must append the '-javaagent' and '-Djava.library.path' parameters to the Java application's startup command. Update the file paths if Power Automate Desktop is installed in a custom location. These flags ensure the Java bridge and native library are activated for UI automation integration. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/java.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` -javaagent:\"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Power Automate Desktop\\java-support\\PAD.JavaBridge.jar\" -Djava.library.path=\"${env_var:PATH};C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Power Automate Desktop\\java-support\\x64\" ``` LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` -javaagent:\"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Power Automate Desktop\\java-support\\PAD.JavaBridge.jar\" -Djava.library.path=\"${env_var:PATH};C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Power Automate Desktop\\java-support\\x86\" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Application Server Connection String Template for SAP ERP DESCRIPTION: JSON template for configuring application server connection settings including host, client ID, system number and logon type. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-sap-erp.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"AppServerHost":"","Client":"","SystemNumber":"", "MessageServerService":"", "LogonType": "Group", "SystemID": "", "Client": "", "LogonGroup":""} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling or Disabling Picture-in-Picture Mode Using Command Line DESCRIPTION: Commands to enable or disable the picture-in-picture run mode on a machine from an administrative Command Prompt. The command must be run from the Power Automate installation directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/run-desktop-flows-pip.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` cd C:\Program Files (x86)\Power Automate Desktop PAD.ChildSession.Installer.Host.exe ``` LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` cd C:\Program Files (x86)\Power Automate Desktop PAD.ChildSession.Installer.Host.exe -d ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparing Commercial and US Government Power Automate Service URLs DESCRIPTION: Provides a side-by-side comparison of URLs for accessing Power Automate services and related portals in commercial versus US Government environments (GCC, GCC High, DoD). This table helps users identify the correct endpoint based on their specific government cloud instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/us-govt.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` Commercial version | US Government version ------ | -------- [https://flow.microsoft.com](https://flow.microsoft.com) | [https://gov.flow.microsoft.us (GCC)](https://gov.flow.microsoft.us), [https://high.flow.microsoft.us (GCC High)](https://high.flow.microsoft.us), and [https://flow.appsplatform.us (DoD)](https://flow.appsplatform.us (DoD)) [https://admin.powerplatform.microsoft.com/](https://admin.powerplatform.microsoft.com/) | [ https://gcc.admin.powerplatform.microsoft.us/ (GCC)](https://gcc.admin.powerplatform.microsoft.us/), [https://high.admin.powerplatform.microsoft.us/ (GCC High)](https://high.admin.powerplatform.microsoft.us/), and [https://admin.appsplatform.us](https://admin.appsplatform.us) (DoD) [https://flow.microsoft.com/connectors](https://flow.microsoft.com/connectors) | [https://gov.flow.microsoft.us/connectors (GCC)](https://gov.flow.microsoft.us/connectors), [https://high.flow.microsoft.us/connectors (GCC High)](https://high.flow.microsoft.us/connectors), [https://flow.appsplatform.us/connectors/](https://flow.appsplatform.us/connectors/) (DoD) |[https://make.powerautomate.com](https://make.powerautomate.com)|[https://make.gov.powerautomate.us (GCC)](https://make.gov.powerautomate.us), [https://make.high.powerautomate.us (GCC High)](https://make.high.powerautomate.us), and [https://make.powerautomate.appsplatform.us (DoD)](https://make.powerautomate.appsplatform.us) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Application Server Connection String Example DESCRIPTION: Example JSON configuration for connecting to a SAP server at sap.contoso.com with system number 00 and client id 100. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-sap-erp.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` {"AppServerHost":"sap.contoso.com","Client":"100","SystemNumber":"00","LogonType":"ApplicationServer"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overview Tab Activity Section in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing and describing the visualization components in the Activity section of the Overview tab, including metrics on flow runs and errors. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/automation-center-overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Visual | Description | | --- | --- | | **Top-level flows** | Number of top-level flows that had one or more runs based on selected filters. Gives an overall automation health indication and helps identify which top-level runs are failing the most. | | **Total runs**| Number of flow runs based on selected filters. | | **Flow runs error rate** | Percentage of errors that occurred during flow execution based on selected filters. | | **Flow runs error trends** | Tracks usage and reliability trends of top-level runs over time. | | **Top flow runs** | Quickly identify critical and regularly failing automations, in order to improve health, resiliency, and exception handling. | | **Flow run failures**| Shows latest flows that failed and might need to be modified to reduce desktop flow failures. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Signing a Cabinet File with SignTool in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command using SignTool to sign the generated cabinet file with a trusted certificate. This step is required before uploading the custom action to Power Automate. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/how-to/build-custom-action/buildcustomaction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` Signtool sign /f "C:/PADActions/PADCustomActionCert.pfx" /p /fd SHA256 "C:/PADActions/PADCustomActionEventLog/PADCustomActionEventLog.cab" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Changing Power Automate Service Account via Command-Line Tool - Shell DESCRIPTION: This shell command changes the Windows account that the Power Automate UIFlowService runs as, using a bundled console tool. It is required when default virtual accounts lack necessary network or service privileges. Dependencies include TroubleshootingTool.Console.exe (bundled with Power Automate Desktop) and administrative privileges. Key parameters: the full account name (including domain) and a plaintext file containing the password, which must be created and removed securely. Input: service account credentials. Output: Service account is changed for UIFlowService. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/troubleshoot.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` TroubleshootingTool.Console.exe ChangeUIFlowServiceAccount mydomain\myuser < tempfilethatcontainspassword.txt ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Average Case Duration per Attribute Value (Activities/Edges) DESCRIPTION: Calculates the average duration using the 'CasesPerAttribute' context, grouping by cases that flow across activities and edges. The result is the average duration for all cases sharing the same (implicitly defined) attribute value. Activities and edges containing the same set of cases will display the same average duration. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/calculation-context.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: PowerAutomateExpression CODE: ``` AVG(CasesPerAttribute, DURATION()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using OData Filter Expressions with Dataverse Triggers in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Examples of OData filter expressions that can be used with the Dataverse trigger to make flows run only when specific conditions are met. These expressions filter rows based on field values without requiring the '$filter=' prefix used in direct API calls. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/dataverse/create-update-delete-trigger.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: OData CODE: ``` firstname eq 'John' ``` LANGUAGE: OData CODE: ``` contains(firstname,'John') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Invoking Cabinet Creation PowerShell Script DESCRIPTION: Command to invoke the cabinet creation PowerShell script with parameters for source directory, target directory, and cabinet filename. This is used after creating the script to generate the required cabinet file. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-custom-actions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` .\{name of script containing the .cab compression directions}.ps1 "{absolute path to the source directory containing the .dll files}" "{target dir to save cab}" {cabName}.cab ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Working Time Duration Between Dates in Power Automate Expressions DESCRIPTION: Calculates the total working time duration between a '[startDate]' and an '[endDate]' based on the active calendar configuration. Both inputs are DATE type, and the output is FLOAT. Note the limitation: calculations are only accurate within a range from 6 months before the process start to 24 months after the process end. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/date-and-time-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: powerautomate-expression CODE: ``` DURATIONCALENDAR([startDate], [endDate]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Dataverse Action for Secret Change Notification in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This configuration details the Dataverse 'Perform an unbound action' settings within a Power Automate cloud flow. It uses the 'NotifyEnvironmentVariableSecretChange' action, mapping the Key Vault URL from the trigger's 'Topic' and the Secret Name from the trigger's 'Subject' to notify the Dataverse environment about the secret update. This action is part of a deprecated workflow for credential updates. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-AzureKeyVault-credential.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 2. Action: Perform an unbound action (Dataverse) - Action name: **NotifyEnvironmentVariableSecretChange** - KeyVaultUrl: **Topic** - Secret name: **Subject** ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Finished Case Status in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: This function is used within custom metrics in Power Automate Process Mining to check if a specific case is categorized as 'Finished'. It returns True if the case meets the user-defined criteria for being finished (typically ending with a specific activity), and False otherwise. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/case-categorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Process Mining Expression CODE: ``` ISFINISHED() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Provisioning Power Automate Hosted Machine Groups Service Principal using Azure CLI DESCRIPTION: This Azure CLI command creates the necessary Azure Active Directory service principal for Power Automate Hosted Machine Groups using its specific application ID. This command should be executed if the service principal cannot be found when assigning the 'Network Contributor' role via the Azure portal. Requires Azure CLI to be installed and authenticated. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/hosted-machine-groups.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: azurecli CODE: ``` az ad sp create --id 51699864-8078-4c9e-a688-09a1db1b2e09 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving BPF Stages via Web API HTTP GET DESCRIPTION: This HTTP GET request retrieves all available process stages for a specific Business Process Flow definition using the Web API. It filters the 'processstages' entity based on the provided 'workflowid' of the BPF definition and selects only the 'stagename' for the response. This is useful for obtaining stage IDs needed for creating or updating BPF instances. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/business-process-flows-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET [Organization URI]/api/data/v9.0/processstages?$select=stagename&$filter=processid/workflowid eq 2669927e-8ad6-4f95-8a9a-f1008af6956f HTTP/1.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Condition Action for SAP Validation Result in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Details the setup of a 'Condition' action in Power Automate to check the result of the preceding SAP function call. It uses the dynamic content 'TYPE' output from the 'Call SAP function' action to determine the flow path. The main RPA flow (SAP RPA Playbook Demo Desktop flow) is placed in the 'If yes' branch, while error handling (email, terminate) is placed in the 'If no' branch. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/data-pre-validation-SAP-ERP.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Action: Condition Choose value: [Dynamic Content: TYPE from 'Check whether the personnel number exists' action] Condition Operator: [e.g., is equal to] Choose value: [Expected Success Value/Type] If yes Branch: - Action: SAP RPA Playbook Demo Desktop flow If no Branch: - Action: Send an email - Action: Terminate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Secure Input Using PowerShell Echo DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to securely provide client secret and password through string redirection SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/machines-silent-registration.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` echo clientsecret mypassword | .\PAD.MachineRegistration.Silent.exe -joinmachinegroup -applicationid appid -clientsecret -groupid groupid -grouppassword -tenantid tenantid ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Duration Between First and Last 'C' Activity in Process Mining Expression DESCRIPTION: This expression calculates the duration between the start of the first event with Activity 'C' and the end of the last event with Activity 'C' within each case. It uses `FIRSTIF(CaseEvents, Activity == "C")` to find the first matching event and `LASTIF(CaseEvents, Activity == "C")` to find the last, then subtracts the `Start()` timestamp of the first from the `End()` timestamp of the last. This performs a conditional aggregation over events within a case (`CaseEvents` context) and produces a single duration result per case. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/custom-metrics-advanced-examples.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Process Mining Expression CODE: ``` LASTIF(CaseEvents, Activity == "C").End() - FIRSTIF(CaseEvents, Activity == "C").Start() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending Widget Actions with Widget JS SDK Using JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the general usage of the widget.notify() method from the Widget JS SDK to send actions or messages to a Power Automate widget, returning a promise. The first parameter specifies the widget action to invoke as a string, and the second parameter is the payload matching the corresponding action's parameter interface. Handles and logs promise fulfillment or rejection. Requires the Widget JS SDK to be loaded and initialized, and assumes a widget handle is available as 'widget'. Expects applicable widget action strings and payload objects as inputs; outputs are handled via promise resolution or error handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/embed-flow-dev.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` widget.notify('', parameterMatchingParameterInterface) .then(result => console.log(result)) .catch(error => console.log(error)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using MINIF for Conditional Minimum Aggregation in Power Automate Expressions (Pseudo-Expression Language) DESCRIPTION: MINIF produces the minimal value among those meeting a provided boolean condition within a context group. Inputs: [context], [condition] (boolean), [value], [default] (fallback). Output is float, time, or analogous type. Enables minimum filtered case calculations. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/aggregations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: pseudo-expression CODE: ``` MINIF([context],[condition],[value],[default]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Signing a DLL File with SignTool in PowerShell DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command using SignTool to sign a custom action DLL with a trusted certificate. This ensures the DLL is trusted by Power Automate for desktop. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/how-to/build-custom-action/buildcustomaction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` Signtool sign /f "C:/PADActions/PADCustomActionCert.pfx" /p /fd SHA256 "C:/PADActions/PADCustomActionEventLog/Modules.LogEvent.dll" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Time Interval Component Functions DESCRIPTION: Functions for extracting components from time intervals. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/date-and-time-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` DAYS([time]) HOURS([time]) MILLISECONDS([time]) MINUTES([time]) SECONDS([time]) TOTALDAYS([time]) TOTALHOURS([time]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Export Options Configuration Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown table defining the available export options and their descriptions for Power Automate Process Mining, including filters, export types, file formats, compression options, and statistics configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/export.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Option | Description | |--------------------|------------------| | Apply filters | Specify if set filters in the currently open view should be applied to the process before export. If the filters aren't applied, all records in the process will be exported. | | Export type | Select either **Cases** or **Events**. When you export events, the entire process log is exported. When you export cases, the selected information about cases without respective individual events is exported. | | Export as | Share specific findings in the process, for example when filtering is applied. Data can be imported again by another user who has the resource file (export). The following formats are supported: **CSV** (comma separated records), **XES** (Extensible Event Stream), and **MXML** (Mining eXtensible Markup Language). | | Export as ZIP | Compress the exported file into ZIP format. If you select this, select the type of compression to use. Choose from among **Optimal**, **Fastest**, or **No compression**. | | Delimiter | Enter a record separator When exporting to the CSV format. | | (For exporting cases) Statistics to export | Select which metrics and attributes will be exported with individual cases. The attributes exported with the case must be imported as the case-level attributes. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Join Machine Group Command DESCRIPTION: Command to silently join a machine group using service principal authentication SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/machines-silent-registration.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: CMD CODE: ``` .\PAD.MachineRegistration.Silent.exe -joinmachinegroup -groupid groupid -grouppassword -applicationid appid -clientsecret (or -certificatethumbprint thumbprint) -tenantid tenantid -environmentid envid ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Working Hours to a Date in Power Automate Expressions DESCRIPTION: Adds a specified number ('[count]', INT type) of working hours to a given '[date]' (DATE type), respecting the working hours and non-working days defined in the active calendar. Returns the resulting DATE. Note the limitation: calculations are only accurate within a range from 6 months before the process start to 24 months after the process end. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/date-and-time-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: powerautomate-expression CODE: ``` ADDWORKINGHOURS([date],[count]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Silent Installation Command - CMD DESCRIPTION: Basic command for silent installation of Power Automate with EULA acceptance SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/install-silently.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: CMD CODE: ``` Setup.Microsoft.PowerAutomate.exe -Silent -Install -ACCEPTEULA ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Average Start Date for Edges - Metric Formula DESCRIPTION: Calculates the average start date for a specified edge, using valid edge aggregation functions. Access to event-level attributes is restricted. Inputs are edge instances; output is a numerical or date value representing the average start. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/requirements-for-application.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: pseudo-code CODE: ``` AVG(AllInView,START()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing SAP Status Bar Text using VBScript DESCRIPTION: This VBScript code snippet demonstrates how to access the text content of the first pane (pane[0]) within the SAP status bar (`sbar`) of the main window (`wnd[0]`). It requires an active SAP GUI `session` object obtained via the SAP GUI Scripting Engine and returns the current status bar text as a string. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/extracting-information-from-SAP-GUI-UI.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: vbscript CODE: ``` session.findById("wnd[0]/sbar/pane[0]").Text ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Triggering Power Automate Desktop Flow via Command Prompt DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to trigger a Power Automate desktop flow using the command prompt. It's applicable for MSI installations of Power Automate. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/run-desktop-flows-url-shortcuts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` "C:\Program Files (x86)\Power Automate Desktop\PAD.Console.Host.exe" "ms-powerautomate:/console/flow/run?workflowName=[workflowName]" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Average Event Duration per Specific Attribute (Statistics) DESCRIPTION: Calculates the average duration using the 'EventsPerAttribute' context within a Statistics event-level attribute context. It returns the average duration of all events in the view sharing the same value for a specified attribute (e.g., Resource). SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/calculation-context.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: PowerAutomateExpression CODE: ``` AVG(EventsPerAttribute, DURATION()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Email Address Array in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example of an array containing email addresses in JSON format. This array is used to demonstrate the join operation in Power Automate. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/data-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JSON CODE: ``` ["d@example.com", "k@example.com", "dal@example.com"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Power Automate Desktop Auto-Updates via Registry Keys DESCRIPTION: Defines the Windows Registry DWORD values required to enable regular automatic updates or disable emergency automatic updates for Power Automate for desktop. Administrator rights are needed to modify these keys under 'SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Global'. Regular updates are disabled by default (requires setting 'EnableRegularAutoUpdates' to 1 to enable), while emergency updates are enabled by default (requires setting 'DisableEmergencyAutoUpdates' to 1 to disable). SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/auto-update.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Registry Path: SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Global | Key | Name | Type | Value | |-------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------|-------|-------| | SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Global | EnableRegularAutoUpdates | DWORD | If set to `1`, regular automatic updates are enabled. | | SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Global | DisableEmergencyAutoUpdates | DWORD | If set to `1`, emergency automatic updates are disabled. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Specific User's Connections in Power Automate using PowerShell (Admin) DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script enables an administrator to delete all Power Automate connections created by a specific user. It requires authenticating as an admin (`Add-PowerAppsAccount`), specifying the target user's ID in the `$deleteDsrUserId` variable, retrieving their connections using `Get-AdminPowerAppConnection -CreatedBy`, and then deleting them using `Remove-AdminConnection`. Requires the Power Apps Admin PowerShell module and appropriate administrative privileges. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/privacy-dsr-delete.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` ```PowerShell Add-PowerAppsAccount $deleteDsrUserId = "{userID}" #Retrieves all connections for the specified userID and deletes them Get-AdminPowerAppConnection -CreatedBy $deleteDsrUserId | Remove-AdminConnection ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Signing DLL Files Using SignTool in Command Prompt DESCRIPTION: Command to sign a DLL file using the SignTool utility in a Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio. This command specifies the certificate file, password, hashing algorithm, and target DLL path. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-custom-actions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: Batch CODE: ``` Signtool sign /f {your certificate name}.pfx /p {your password for exporting the certificate} /fd SHA256 {path to the .dll you want to sign}.dll ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing SAS Key Regeneration in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Fetch request template for regenerating the SAS access key in Power Automate HTTP trigger flows. The code makes a POST request to the regenerateAccessKey endpoint using the authorization header from the flow details page. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/regenerate-sas-key.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` fetch('', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-type': 'application/json; charset=UTF-8', 'Authorization': '' } }) .then(result => result.json()) .then(console.log) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Feature Comparison Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown table comparing features between Approvals Connector and Approvals Kit, including core use cases, product features, triggers, and requirements. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/business-approvals-templates/approvals-kit-comparison.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Feature |Approvals Connector|Approvals Kit| |--------------------|-------------------|-------------| |Core use case |Simple approvals without need for advance approval features|No-code workflow designer with extra features| |Core Product Feature|Yes |No (requires install)| |Trigger via Power Automate|Yes |Yes| |Requires Azure Application Registration|No|Yes| |Premium Connector(s) |No |Yes (requires Dataverse and custom connector)| |Requires Dataverse |No |Yes| |Requires Power App License|No |Yes, to build and manage approvals workflows| |Multi stage approvals|Not by default. Requires multiple cloud flows or other custom implementation|Yes| |Delegated approvers |Not by default. Requires custom implementation|Yes| |Design / Authoring |Copilot and Power Automate Designer|No-code Power App Process Designer| |Versioning |Cloud flow versions|Dataverse-based workflow stages and data versions| |Workdays / Holidays |Not by default, requires custom implementation|Yes| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Variable Properties for Set Operation in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Configuration table showing the required properties for the Set variable action in Power Automate flows SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/create-variable-store-values.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Property | Required | Value | Description | |----------|----------|-------|--------------|| | **Name** | Yes | <*variable-name*> | The name for the variable to change | | **Value** | Yes | <*new-value*> | The value you want to assign the variable. Both must have the same data type. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authenticating Power Apps Environment using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command initiates the authentication process for connecting to a specific Power Apps environment. It requires the latest PowerShell cmdlets for Power Apps to be installed. Running this command opens a separate window prompting for Microsoft Entra credentials for the desired environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/how-tos-restore-deleted-flow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` Add-PowerAppsAccount ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining SOURCE() and TARGET() for Path Event Durations in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Calculates the sum of the durations of the path's starting event (`SOURCE(Duration())`) and the path's ending event (`TARGET(Duration())`). The `SOURCE()` and `TARGET()` operations change the context to the respective events of the path. This metric is applicable on the process map within the edge (path) context. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/other-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: dsl CODE: ``` SUM(SOURCE(Duration())+TARGET(Duration())) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Stuck Case Status in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: This function is used within custom metrics in Power Automate Process Mining to determine if a case is categorized as 'Stuck'. A case qualifies as 'Stuck' if it isn't 'Finished' and the duration since its last recorded event exceeds a predefined threshold relative to a specified date. Returns True if the case is 'Stuck', False otherwise. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/case-categorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Process Mining Expression CODE: ``` ISSTUCK() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: PowerShell .NET 8 Runtime Download URLs DESCRIPTION: URLs required for downloading .NET 8 runtime packages needed for Power Automate desktop version 2.55 and above. These URLs must be accessible for proper installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/install.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` https://aka.ms/dotnet/8.0/windowsdesktop-runtime-win-x64.exe https://aka.ms/dotnet/8.0/windowsdesktop-runtime-win-x86.exe ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Average Duration of All Activities/Edges - Power Automate Metric Expression DESCRIPTION: Calculates the mean duration for all visible activities, edges, or events using an aggregation formula within the statistics metric editor. This requires the use of event context functions such as DURATION, and the aggregation AVG. Inputs are sets of activities or edges in view; output is a numeric average duration. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/requirements-for-application.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: pseudo-code CODE: ``` AVG(AllInView,DURATION()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Business Approval Record with JSON Data in Power Automate Custom Connector DESCRIPTION: JSON structure used in the CreateWorkflowInstance operation of the custom connector to create a record in the cat_businessapprovalworkflowqueues table. This JSON contains runtime data with approval parameters and the process ID that identifies which workflow to start. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/business-approvals-templates/content.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "cat_runtimedata": "[{\"id\":\"9a664958-c656-ee11-be6f-0022482a97de\",\"value\":\"True\"},{\"id\":\"7ddc1057-c656-ee11-be6f-0022482a91f4\",\"value\":\"123\"},{\"id\":\"49dc1057-c656-ee11-be6f-0022482a91f4\",\"value\":\"\"},{\"id\":\"9b664958-c656-ee11-be6f-0022482a97de\",\"value\":\"10/11/2023 8:49:51 AM\"},{\"id\":\"7cdc1057-c656-ee11-be6f-0022482a91f4\",\"value\":\"Another title\"}]", "cat_processid": "57b2ee16-ea51-ee11-be6f-0022482a97de" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dequeuing Work Queue Item Using FetchXML Query in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: FetchXML query in JSON format used to dequeue a work queue item. This query filters items by work queue ID and status code to retrieve the next available item for processing. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/work-queues-process.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "query": "\n\n\n\n\n\n\n"} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Required SAP Tables for Procure to Pay Template DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive SQL table structure needed for the P2P template implementation, including purchasing documents, requisitions, vendor data, and material master tables. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-finance-ops-templates.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` BKPF -- Accounting Document Header BSEG -- Accounting Document CDHDR -- Change Document Header CDPOS -- Change Document Items EKKO -- Purchasing Document Header EKPO -- Purchasing Document Items EKBE -- History per Purchasing Document EBAN -- Purchase Requisition USR02 -- Logon Data RSEG -- Document item; Incoming Invoice T008T -- Blocking Reason Names NAST -- Message Status DD07T -- DD: Texts for Domain Fixed Values T001 -- Company Codes T024E -- Purchasing Organizations T024 -- Purchasing Groups TCURR -- Exchange Rates data TCURX -- Decimal places in currency LFA1 -- Vendor Master MAKT -- Material Master T023T -- Material Group Descriptions EKET -- Scheduling Agreement Schedule Lines ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Average Edge Duration per Path Attribute (Performance View) DESCRIPTION: Calculates the average duration using the 'EdgesPerAttribute' context, grouping by edges sharing a common attribute value (often representing a specific path). This returns the average duration for all edges in the view for a process map path, representing the standard 'Mean Duration on edges' metric in the Performance view. It's unavailable for events. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/calculation-context.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: PowerAutomateExpression CODE: ``` AVG(EdgesPerAttribute, DURATION()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Documenting Variables Produced by Launching Internet Explorer in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Markdown table listing the variables produced by the 'Launch new Internet Explorer' action, including the Internet Explorer instance for use in browser automation actions. Supports an optional attribute parameter. Supported in event and edge contexts. Returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISLOOPOUTFLOW([attributeName]) Returns true when event/edge has loop outflow. **Supported context:** event, edge **Parameters:** - ***[attributeName]*** - Attribute to calculate repetitions. If none is entered, the default attribute is mining attribute (activity attribute), optional **Output Data Type**: BOOL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Selector1 Action Selector Class - Power Automate Desktop - C# DESCRIPTION: Implements a selector class for the first variation, filtering the main action to only display the 'FirstName' argument and associated message. Uses Prop, ShowAll, and Hide methods to control which properties appear in the UI. The class inherits from ActionSelector with the central action as the type parameter. Intended to be used as a filter, not as an action itself. Requires SDK namespaces and the SelectorChoice enum. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-custom-actions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` public class Selector1 : ActionSelector { public Selector1() { UseName("DisplayOnlyFirstName"); Prop(p => p.Selector).ShouldBe(SelectorChoice.Selector1); ShowAll(); Hide(p => p.LastName); Hide(p => p.Age); // or // Show(p => p.FirstName); // Show(p => p.DisplayedMessage); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Variable Properties for Decrement Operation in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Configuration table showing the required properties for the Decrement variable action in Power Automate flows SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/create-variable-store-values.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Property | Required | Value | Description | |----------|----------|-------|--------------|| | **Name** | Yes | <*variable-name*> | The name for the variable to decrement | | **Value** | No | <*increment-value*> | The value for decrementing the variable. The default value is one. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Signing in to Power Platform Tenant using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: Authenticates a user to their Power Platform tenant using the `Add-PowerAppsAccount` cmdlet. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/business-process-flows-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: HTTP CODE: ``` GET [Organization URI]/api/data/v9.0/workflows?$filter=name eq 'My Custom BPF'&$select=uniquename HTTP/1.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a Row to a Datatable in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add a new row to an existing datatable using the Set variable action and the plus character notation in Power Automate desktop flows. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/variable-data-types.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: PowerAutomate CODE: ``` Set variable DatatableVariable to %DatatableVariable + ['Product3', '30 USD']% ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Display Machine Registration Help Menu DESCRIPTION: Command to show the help menu for the silent registration application SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/machines-silent-registration.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: CMD CODE: ``` .\PAD.MachineRegistration.Silent.exe -help ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Message Server Connection String Example DESCRIPTION: Example JSON configuration for connecting to a message server at 10.0.0.1 with port 3333, client ID 800 and logon group COTO. This action stops the flow execution and explicitly sets its final status to 'Failed' when the initial SAP data validation fails. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/data-pre-validation-SAP-ERP.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Action: Terminate (within 'If no' branch, after Send email) Status: Failed ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining ISSELFLOOP() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Checks if an event or edge has a self-loop repetition. Supports an optional attribute parameter. Supported in event and edge contexts. Returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISSELFLOOP([attributeName]) Returns true when event/edge has self-loop repetition. **Supported context:** event, edge **Parameters:** - ***[attributeName]*** - Attribute to calculate repetitions. Supports an optional attribute parameter. Supported in event and edge contexts. Returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISLOOP([attributeName]) Returns true when event/edge has loop repetition. **Supported context:** event, edge **Parameters:** - ***[attributeName]*** - Attribute to calculate repetitions. Enables filtered maximum-attribute selection logic for advanced metrics. It covers details such as expected data types, defaults, and parameter roles, including connection references and folder specifications. Prerequisites include familiarity with Power Automate variable data types and basic Exchange concepts; it highlights necessary and optional parameters, expected values, and operational constraints for robust email automation. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/exchange.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` ### Input parameters |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Exchange connection|No|[Exchange connection](../variable-data-types.md#connections)||The Exchange connection. Create an Exchange connection with the 'Connect to Exchange server' action| |Email message(s) to process|No|[List](../variable-data-types.md#list) of [Exchange mail messages](../variable-data-types.md#exchange)||The email message(s) to process. Use a variable populated by a 'Retrieve Exchange email messages' action| |Operation|N/A|Delete email messages from server, Mark email messages as unread, Move email messages to mail folder|Move email messages to mail folder|Specifies which operation to perform on the specified email messages| |Mailbox type|N/A|Personal, Shared|Personal|The type of the mailbox to retrieve email messages from| |Shared mailbox address|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The address of the shared mailbox to retrieve email messages from| |Move to custom folder|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|False|Specifies whether to move email messages to a custom folder or a predefined Exchange folder| |Exchange folder|N/A|Inbox, Deleted items, Drafts, Outbox, Sent items, Junk email|Inbox|A predefined Exchange folder to move email messages from| |Mail folder|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|Inbox|The name or path (e.g. folder1\folder2) of the mail-folder to move email messages to| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Counting Total Events in the Process using PROCESS() DESCRIPTION: Returns the total number of events across the entire process within the current view. The `PROCESS()` operation changes the context of the `EventCount()` calculation to the overall process level. This metric can be used in any custom metric context (process, case, event, edge).
