It uses markdown syntax to format the note as a callout. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/us-govt.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` >[!NOTE] >Power Automate US Government DoD is only available to DoD entities. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Entity Relationship Table for Process Data DESCRIPTION: Table defining the core process data entities in the semantic model, including Cases, Events, CaseMetrics, and other key components that change when process model data is refreshed or views are modified. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-fabric-semantic-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Entity|Description| |------|-----------| |Cases|List of all cases and their attributes in the process. Each case contains a unique Case ID display, and values for each of the *case attributes*, as defined in the mapping setup step. Combine with *CaseMetrics* entity to get complete case information.| |Events|List of all event attributes in the process. Each event has a unique event identifier index, and values for each of the *event attributes*, as defined in the mapping setup step. Combine with *ProcessMapMetrics* entity filtered by `Is_Node` column to get a complete event information.| |CaseMetrics|Entity holds all case-level metrics related to a specific combination of case and view. *Case level custom metrics* defined in Power Automate Process Mining desktop app will be added to this entity.| |AttributesMetadata|Entity holds the definition of all case/event-level attributes as defined in the import of event log data into process model. It includes its datatype, attribute type, and attribute level being either case or event.| |MiningAttributes|Holds values of available mining attributes. A process view can be set up to look at the process from different perspective based on the selected mining attribute. If no other mining attribute is available, the entity holds the values of `Activity` attribute.| |Views|List of available (published) views created in the Power Automate Process Mining desktop app. Only public process views are published to the data set. Entries can be used to filter report, report page, and visual to visualize only data from the specific process view.| |Variants|Entity holds the relations between variants and process views. A record is included if a particular variant is included in a view after the filtering criteria are taken into account.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pressing Buttons in SAP GUI Windows using Power Automate Desktop DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the 'Press button in window' action to interact with buttons in SAP GUI windows, such as the 'Save' button. This is typically used for common elements like footers or banners. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/dataverse/search.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` Boolean operators| Provides an expanded set compared to simple query syntax. \nAND operator; denoted by AND, &&, + \nOR operator; denoted by OR, ||\nNOT operator; denoted by NOT, !, – \nWildcards | Trailing wildcard – "alp*"\nLeading wildcard - ".*pine"\nFuzzy search | "Uniersty~" will return "University"\n"Blue~1" will return "glue", "blues"\nTerm boosting | "Rock^2 electronic"\nProximity search | "airport hotel"~5\nRegular expression (regex) search | /[mh]otel/ matches "motel" or "hotel" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining MEDIAN() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Calculates the approximate median of values grouped by a defined context. Supports process, case, event, and edge contexts. Takes context, value, and optional compression parameters. Returns various data types. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## MEDIAN([context],[value],[compression]) Calculates the approximate median of values grouped according to the defined context. **Supported context:** process, case, event, edge **Parameters:** - ***[context]*** - defines the context in which the operation is calculated Data type: STRING (only fixed string is allowed) - ***[value]*** - value over which the median is calculated Data type: STRING (only fixed string is allowed) - ***[compression]*** - controls the estimation accuracy and memory utilization. High compression values increase the accuracy of estimation but make the operation slower. The value must be between 20 and 1000, the default value is 200. Data type: FLOAT **Output Data Type**: INT, FLOAT, DATE, TIME ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Region Mapping Table for Power Automate and Gateways DESCRIPTION: A markdown table showing the mapping between Power Platform regions and corresponding gateway regions, essential for proper gateway installation and flow deployment. The script retrieves the DLP policy, gets all desktop flow modules, removes them from connector groups, and saves the updated policy. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/prevent-data-loss.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` $policies = Get-DlpPolicy $dlpPolicy = $policies.value | Where-Object { $_.displayName -eq "My DLP Policy" } $desktopFlowModules = Get-DesktopFlowModules foreach ($connectorGroup in $dlpPolicy.connectorGroups) { $connectorGroup.connectors = $connectorGroup.connectors | Where-Object { $desktopFlowModules.id -notcontains $_.id } } Set-DlpPolicy -PolicyName $dlpPolicy.name -UpdatedPolicy $dlpPolicy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Table - DLP Violation Alert DESCRIPTION: Details for alerts regarding desktop flows suspended due to Data Loss Prevention policy violations, including investigation steps and remediation actions. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/automation-center-recommendations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Category or object | Details | |---|---| | Title | Desktop flow suspended due to DLP policy violation | | Card details | {*number of flows*} desktop flow(s) are suspended due to DLP policy violations | | Recommendation details | Investigate why suspended flows aren't in compliance with your organization's DLP (Data Loss Prevention) policy. | | Type | Error | | Refresh frequency | Hourly | | Category | Governance | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Input Parameters for Get Current Date and Time Action DESCRIPTION: This markdown table defines the input parameters for the 'Get current date and time' action, including options for retrieving date only or date and time, and specifying time zones. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/datetime.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Retrieve|N/A|Current date and time, Current date only|Current date and time|Specify whether to get the date and time, or just the date. If the latter is chosen, the time value will be stored as midnight (0:00:00)| |Time zone|N/A|System time zone, Specific time zone **(to be deprecated)**, Windows time zone, Custom input|System time zone|Specify whether to use the system's time zone or select a specific one or set up a time zone manually| |Country/region|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|Europe/Bucharest|The country/region to get the time of or add a numeric value as the hours that will be added in the UTC time zone| |Windows time zone|No|Available [Windows time zones](/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones#time-zones)|(UTC) Coordinated Universal Time|Specify the country/region to obtain the time zone from| |Input Type|No|Offset, Windows time zone|Offset|Choose whether to set the offset via a numeric value or by providing a Windows format time zone| |Offset|No|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)|N/A|Specify the number of hours the offset is going to be. Time format is UTC.| |Time zone|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|N/A|Specify the time zone (Windows time zone)| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Incomplete Import Flag in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: This function is used within custom metrics in Power Automate Process Mining to check if a case has been flagged as 'Incompletely imported'. This flag indicates that the case might be missing its initial events because it doesn't begin with one of the defined starting activities. Returns True if the 'Incompletely imported' flag is set for the case, False otherwise. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/case-categorization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Process Mining Expression CODE: ``` ISINCOMPLETEIMPORT() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Identifying Desktop Flow Runs with Cryptographic PowerShell Code using SQL DESCRIPTION: This SQL query scans the `flowlog` table for 'Run PowerShell script' actions executed within the last 7 days. It aims to identify potentially risky operations by checking if the script inputs (extracted from the JSON `data` column) contain keywords associated with cryptography like 'AES', 'RSA', 'encryption', or 'decryption'. It returns the action name, inputs, and outputs of the first matching log entry found. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/automation-analytics-with-fabric-queries.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` -- Queries actions logs named 'Run PowerShell script' that contain code that that uses cryptographic libraries -- and terms such as "AES", "RSA", "encryption", or "decryption," which may indicate risky operations SELECT top(1) JSON_VALUE(data, '$.name') AS ActionName, JSON_VALUE(data, '$.inputs') AS Inputs, JSON_VALUE(data, '$.outputs') AS Outputs FROM [flowlog] WHERE JSON_VALUE(data, '$.name') = 'Run PowerShell script' AND createdon >= DATEADD(day, -7, GETDATE()) AND ( JSON_VALUE(data, '$.inputs') LIKE '%AES%' OR JSON_VALUE(data, '$.inputs') LIKE '%RSA%' OR JSON_VALUE(data, '$.inputs') LIKE '%encryption%' OR JSON_VALUE(data, '$.inputs') LIKE '%decryption%' ) ORDER BY ActionName ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Timespan to Total Milliseconds in Power Automate Expressions DESCRIPTION: Calculates the total duration of a given timespan value, expressed in whole and fractional milliseconds. The input parameter must be of TIME data type, and the function returns a FLOAT. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/date-and-time-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: powerautomate-expression CODE: ``` TOTALMILLIS([time]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Event Case Aggregation with Case-Wide Context DESCRIPTION: Two-step aggregation to count cases containing C->C edges per country. Uses nested formula for edge checking and case aggregation by attribute value. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/custom-metrics-advanced-examples.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: process-mining-expression CODE: ``` COUNTIF(CasesPerAttribute(), ANY(Edge(), STARTACTIVITY() = "C" AND ENDACTIVITY() = "C")) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Azure Exceptions Table DESCRIPTION: Documentation table listing possible exceptions and error conditions for Azure operations including resource group and disk management failures. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/azure.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Exception|Description| |-----|-----| |Failed to get the resource groups with the specified criteria|Indicates that getting the resource groups with the specified criteria failed| |Resource group already exists|Indicates that the resource group already exists and can't be created| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Numeric List - Power Fx - Power Fx DESCRIPTION: Initializes a list of numeric values 1, 2, 3, and 4. In Power Fx, lists use one-based indexing and are commonly used for iteration and data manipulation in desktop flows. No dependencies are required to use list literals. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/power-fx.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Power Fx CODE: ``` "= [1,2,3,4]" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining WAITINGTIME() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Returns the waiting time of a case. Supported only in case context. Output is of TIME data type. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## WAITINGTIME() Returns case waiting time. **Supported context:** case **Output Data Type**: TIME ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Get Clipboard Text Exceptions DESCRIPTION: Exception table documenting potential errors when retrieving clipboard contents. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/clipboard.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Exception|Description| |-----|-----| |Can't retrieve clipboard contents|Indicates a problem retrieving clipboard contents| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Blocking All Desktop Flow Modules in a DLP Policy using PowerShell DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script retrieves a specific DLP policy named 'My DLP Policy', fetches all available Power Automate for desktop flow modules, and adds them all to the 'Blocked' classification group within that policy. It requires the Power Platform PowerShell cmdlets and assumes the existence of the specified policy. This script is useful for administrators who need to block all modules programmatically, especially if the 'Show desktop flow actions in DLP policies' UI setting is not enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/prevent-data-loss.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` # Step #1: Retrieve a DLP policy named 'My DLP Policy' $dlpPolicies = Get-DlpPolicy  $dlpPolicy = $dlpPolicies.value | where {$_.displayName -eq 'My DLP Policy'}  # Step #2: Get all Power Automate for desktop flow modules $desktopFlowModules = Get-DesktopFlowModules  # Step #3: Convert the list of Power Automate for desktop flow modules to a format that can be added to the policy $desktopFlowModulesToAddToPolicy = @()  foreach ($modules in $desktopFlowModules) {  $desktopFlowModulesToAddToPolicy += [pscustomobject]@{  id=$modules.id  name=$modules.Properties.displayName  type=$modules.type  }  }  # Step #4: Add all desktop flow modules to the 'blocked' category of 'My DLP Policy' Add-ConnectorsToPolicy -Connectors $desktopFlowModulesToAddToPolicy -PolicyName $dlpPolicy.name -classification Blocked -Verbose ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Power BI Report Filter Note Block DESCRIPTION: Markdown note block indicating the default Power BI report filter setting SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-visualize.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > [!NOTE]\n> The standard report applies the Power BI report filter set to **ViewID = 1**, which usually is the view named **Default**. All report pages and visualisations reflect this filter by default, unless changed. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Access Parameters Table - Run Access Query DESCRIPTION: Table showing input parameters for executing an Access query. Ensure the parameter names and data types match the ones in the query.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: PowerShell Command for Bulk Flow-App Association DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command used by administrators to associate flows and apps in bulk through the Power Platform admin interface. It allows selection of specific pages, customization of image naming, and choosing the save location for extracted images. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/pdf.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## Extract images from PDF To extract images from a PDF file you can use the **Extract images from PDF** action. In the action parameters you can define the PDF file and the pages to extract images from, the naming convention of the extacted images and the target location of the saved images. You can also define a password if the PDF file is protected under the advanced settings. ### Input parameters |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |PDF file|No|[File](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)||The PDF file to extract images from. Enter a file path, a variable containing a file or a text path| |Password|Yes|Direct encrypted input or [Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The password of the PDF file. Leave this blank if the PDF isn't password protected| |Page(s) to extract|N/A|All, Single, Range|All|Specifies how many pages to extract: All pages, a single page or a range of pages| |Single page number|No|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)||The number of the single page to extract images from| |From page number|No|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)||The first page number from the range of pages to extract images from| |To page number|No|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)||The last page number from the range of pages to extract images from| |Image(s) name|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||How the name of the image(s) starts. Extracted image(s) name example: GivenName_1, GivenName_2| |Save image(s) to|No|[Folder](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)||The folder to save the extracted images as png files| ### Variables produced This action doesn't produce any variables. ### Exceptions |Exception|Description| |-----|-----| |Invalid password|The given password is invalid| |Failed to extract images |Indicates that an error occurred while extracting images from the given pages of the PDF| |Folder doesn't exist|Indicates that the folder doesn't exist| |PDF file doesn't exist|File doesn't exist on the given path| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Registry to Disable Cloud Connector Execution in Power Automate Desktop DESCRIPTION: This registry entry disables the execution of flows containing cloud connectors in Power Automate Desktop. When set to 1, the machine cannot run desktop flows with cloud connectors, and users are informed via an error message. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Global\DisableCloudConnectors ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: YAML Frontmatter Configuration DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration block defining metadata for the documentation page, including author information, service details, and audience targeting. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/manage-machines.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- title: Manage machines description: Manage machines author: mattp123 ms.subservice: desktop-flow ms.topic: conceptual ms.date: 01/14/2025 ms.author: kenseongtan ms.reviewer: matp contributors: - rpapostolis - Yiannismavridis - NikosMoutzourakis - PetrosFeleskouras search.audienceType: - flowmaker - enduser --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Unblocking PowerShell Script DESCRIPTION: Command to unblock the PowerShell script file if restricted by execution policy. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/automation-kit/setup/command-line-install.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` Unblock-File Install_AutomationKit.ps1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Help Command - CMD DESCRIPTION: Command to display available command-line arguments for installation SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/install-silently.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: CMD CODE: ``` Setup.Microsoft.PowerAutomate.exe -HELP ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing SAP GUI Objects in VBScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the initialization of SAP GUI objects, including the application, connection, and session. It also sets up event handling for the session and application objects. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/reviewing-generated-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: VBScript CODE: ``` If Not IsObject(application) Then Set SapGuiAuto = GetObject("SAPGUI") Set application = SapGuiAuto.GetScriptingEngine End If If Not IsObject(connection) Then Set connection = application.Children(0) End If If Not IsObject(session) Then Set session = connection.Children(0) End If If IsObject(WScript) Then WScript.ConnectObject session, "on" WScript.ConnectObject application, "on" End If ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restricting Non-Licensed Org ID Sign-ins via Windows Registry - Registry DESCRIPTION: Prevents users without an attended RPA license from signing into Power Automate for desktop with their work or school accounts by setting 'RestrictNoLicenseOrgIDAccountsSignIns' (DWORD) to 1 in the 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop' registry path under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. Admin access is required, and the value blocks sign-ins where eligible licensing is not present. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n\n[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Power Automate Desktop]\n"RestrictNoLicenseOrgIDAccountsSignIns"=dword:00000001\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Tables for Text Operation Parameters DESCRIPTION: Documentation tables defining input parameters, output variables, and exceptions for various text manipulation operations in Power Automate. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/text.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Original text|No|[Text value]|None|The text to retrieve a section of text from| |Mode|N/A|Get text before/after/between flags|Get text before|Specify text retrieval mode| |Start flag|No|[Text value]|None|The retrieved text will be after this flag| |End flag|No|[Text value]|None|The retrieved text will be before this flag| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Background Workflow Actions Table DESCRIPTION: Markdown table listing available actions in background workflow processes with their descriptions, including Create row, Update row, Assign row, Send Email, and other core operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/configure-workflow-steps.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Action|Description| |------------|------------------| |**Create row**|Creates a new row for a table and assigns values you choose to columns.| |**Update row**|You can update the row that the background workflow is running on, any of the rows linked to that row in an N:1 relationships, or any rows created by earlier steps.| |**Assign row**|You can assign the row that the background workflow is running on, any of the rows linked to that row with an N:1 relationship, or any rows created by earlier steps.| |**Send Email**|Sends an email. You can choose to create a new email message or use an email template configured for the table.| |**Start Child Workflow**|Starts a background workflow process that has been configured as a child workflow.| |**Change Status**|Changes the status of the row that the process is running on.| |**Stop Workflow**|Stops the current workflow. You can set a status of either **Succeeded** or **Canceled**.| |**Custom Step**|Developers can create custom background workflow steps that define actions.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining ISRUNNING() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Checks if a case is categorized as running according to the Process Context - Case Categorization. Supported in case context. Returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISRUNNING() Returns true when the case is categorized as running (as defined in Process Context – Case Categorization) **Supported context:** case **Output Data Type**: BOOL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Styling Power Automate Widget Container in CSS DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet provides a sample style for the Power Automate widget container, which can be modified to match the host application's dimensions. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/embed-flow-dev.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Edge Statistics Metrics Table DESCRIPTION: Markdown table showing various edge statistics metrics and their descriptions, including case frequency, event frequency, duration metrics, and loop-related measurements. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/edge-statistics.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |-----------------------|------------------| | Case frequency | Total number of cases containing a particular edge in the process. | | Case frequency (%) | Percentage of cases containing a particular edge in the process relative to all cases in the process. | | Event frequency | Total number of each edge occurrence in the process. | | Event frequency (%) | Percentage of each edge occurrence in the process relative to all edges. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example MSIX Bundle Filename Format DESCRIPTION: Shows the required naming convention for the MSIX bundle file when setting up custom updates. The filename must include the application name and the latest version number. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/process-mining-custom-install.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` PowerAutomateProcessMining_{latestVersion}.msixbundle ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Unzip files Action Parameters in Power Automate Desktop DESCRIPTION: Defines the input parameters and exceptions for the Unzip files action in Power Automate Desktop. This action uncompresses one or more files or folders contained in a ZIP archive. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/compression.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ### Input parameters |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Archive path|No|[File](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)||The full path of a ZIP file to extract| |Destination folder|No|[Folder](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)||The full path of the folder to extract the archive to. This action overwrites files in the folder with the same name as a file in the archive| |Password|Yes|Direct encrypted input or [Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The password, if any, that is used for this archive. If the ZIP file isn't password-protected, leave this blank| |Include mask|Yes|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The filter to limit the files extracted to the files entered here. This parameter allows wild cards, for example '*.txt' or 'document?.doc' (without the quotes). To allow multiple file filters, separate the choices with a semi-colon, for instance, '*.txt;*.exe'| |Exclude mask|Yes|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The filter to limit the files extracted by excluding the file entered here. This parameter allows wild cards, for example, '*.txt' or 'document?.doc' (without the quotes). To allow multiple file filters, separate the choices with a semi-colon, for instance, '*.txt;*.exe'| ### Variables produced This action doesn't produce any variables. ### Exceptions |Exception|Description| |-----|-----| |Can't create destination folder|Indicates that the destination folder couldn't be created| |Archive not found|Indicates that the archive doesn't exist| |Archive isn't a valid ZIP file|Indicates that the archive isn't a valid ZIP file| |Failed to unzip files|Indicates a problem unzipping the files| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Start Timestamp Custom Column in Power Query (Power Query) DESCRIPTION: This formula is used in Power Query's custom column editor to compute the event's start timestamp in milliseconds since the Unix epoch. It requires a column named StartDate, and uses DateTimeZone and Duration functions to accurately calculate epoch milliseconds. Replace StartDate with your actual timestamp field if named differently. The output is a whole number representing milliseconds since January 1, 1970. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/import-with-milliseconds.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Power Query CODE: ``` Duration.TotalSeconds(DateTimeZone.From([StartDate]) - #datetimezone(1970, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0)) * 1000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying File Selection Dialog in Power Automate Desktop Flow DESCRIPTION: Example of using the Display Select File Dialog action to prompt users to browse for a file, with options to set initial folder and file filter. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/display.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` :::image type="content" source="media/display/display-select-file-example.png" alt-text="Screenshot of the Display select file dialog action."::: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Conditional Evaluation - ANY Function DESCRIPTION: Checks if any elements in a context satisfy a given condition. Commonly used in case metrics filters. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/aggregations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Expression Language CODE: ``` ANY(CaseEvents, eventCost > 0) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Input Parameters for Text Actions in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the structure for defining input parameters for various text manipulation actions in Power Automate. It includes details like argument names, whether they're optional, accepted values, default values, and descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/text.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Use uppercase letters (A-Z)|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|True|Specify whether uppercase characters will be included in the generated text| |Use lowercase letters (a-z)|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|True|Specify whether lowercase characters will be included in the generated text| |Use digits (0-9)|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|True|Specify whether digits will be included in the generated text| |Use symbols ( , . < > ? ! + - _ # $ ^ )|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|True|Specify whether symbols will be included in the generated text| |Minimum length|Yes|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)|6|The minimum length of the random text. For a certain length of text, set the minimum and maximum values to that number| |Maximum length|Yes|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)|10|The maximum length of the random text. For a certain length of text, set the minimum and maximum values to that number| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Certificate Revocation Checks via Windows Registry - Registry DESCRIPTION: Controls certificate revocation validation levels for secure connections in Power Automate for desktop by setting 'CertificateRevocationCheck' (DWORD) in 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Global' under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. Acceptable values are 0 (disabled), 1 (basic, default), or 2 (comprehensive). Proper configuration is vital for compliance and security; default is 1 when not set. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n\n[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Power Automate Desktop\\Global]\n"CertificateRevocationCheck"=dword:00000001\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Desktop Flow Runs with Restricted URL Access using SQL DESCRIPTION: This SQL query retrieves details of desktop flow runs for a specific flow (`[specific_flow_id]`) over the past 21 days where the 'Invoke Web Service' action was used to call predefined, potentially restricted URLs. It joins `flowlog`, `flowsession`, `workflow`, and `systemuser` tables to provide context including action details, flow name, owner information, and timestamps. The `[specific_flow_id]` placeholder needs to be replaced with the actual target flow ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/automation-analytics-with-fabric-queries.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` SELECT JSON_VALUE(f.data, '$.name') AS ActionName, f.data AS 'Action log', f.parentobjectid AS 'Parent object id', f.createdon AS 'Log created on', w.name AS 'Desktop flow', w.workflowid AS 'Desktop flow Id', w.createdon AS 'Created on', w.modifiedon AS 'Last modified on', w.definition AS 'Script', w.ownerid AS 'Owner Id', s.fullname AS 'Owner name', s.internalemailaddress AS 'Owner email' FROM [flowlog] f JOIN flowsession fs ON f.parentobjectid = fs.flowsessionid JOIN workflow w ON fs.regardingobjectid = w.workflowid JOIN systemuser s ON w.ownerid = s.systemuserid WHERE w.workflowid = '[specific_flow_id]' -- Replace with the actual flow ID AND f.createdon >= DATEADD(day, -21, GETDATE()) AND JSON_VALUE(f.data, '$.name') = 'Invoke web service' AND ( f.data LIKE '%contoso-default.crm.dynamics.com/api%' OR f.data LIKE '%api.second-restricted-url.net%' OR f.data LIKE '%api.third-restricted-url.de%' OR f.data LIKE '%api.phishing-example.com%' ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Time To Live (TTL) Value Calculation Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A reference table showing the conversion between days and minutes for common Time To Live (TTL) values used in the Organization and FlowLog tables for queue event retention. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/monitor-run-details.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Days |Minutes | |---------|----------| |1 day |1,140 minutes| |3 days |4,320 minutes| |7 days |10,080 minutes| |14 days |20,160 minutes| |28 days |40,320 minutes| |60 days |68,400 minutes| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparing Event Duration to Case Duration using CASE() in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Calculates the ratio of an individual event's duration (`Duration()`) to the total duration of the case it belongs to (`CASE(Duration())`). The `CASE()` operation shifts the context of the inner `Duration()` calculation from the current event or edge to the overall case level. This metric is applicable in event-level filters. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/other-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: dsl CODE: ``` Duration() / CASE(Duration()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Task Flow Creation Steps in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Step-by-step markdown instructions for creating a mobile task flow in Dynamics 365, including prerequisites, process creation, designer usage, and component configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/create-mobile-task-flow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. Make sure that you have the System Administrator, or System Customizer security role or equivalent permissions. 2. Open solution explorer and select **Processes**. 3. On the **Actions** toolbar, select **New**. 4. In the **Create Process** dialog box, complete the required fields: - Enter a process name. - In the **Category** list, select **Business Process Flow**. - In the **Table** list, select the table you want. 5. Select the **Run process as a task flow (Mobile online)** option. 6. Select **OK**. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extending Canvas App Functionality with Query Parameters DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates modifying an iframe URL to pass contextual information (like lead or account IDs) to a canvas app using JavaScript query string parameters. The code runs on form load to enable embedded app functionality within Dynamics 365 Sales forms. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/replace-dialogs.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` // Example implied from context: function onFormLoad() { const leadId = /* get current lead ID */; const iframeUrl = "baseAppUrl" + "?leadId=" + leadId; // Update iframe source with contextual parameters // Access in app using Param() function } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Business Process Flow Table Name using Organization Service DESCRIPTION: This C# code snippet uses the Organization Service to query and retrieve the unique name of a business process flow table. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/business-process-flows-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` QueryExpression query = new QueryExpression { EntityName = "workflow", ColumnSet = new ColumnSet("uniquename"), Criteria = new FilterExpression { Conditions = { new ConditionExpression { ColumnName = "name", Operator = ConditionOperator.Equal, Values = { "My Custom BPF" } } } } }; Workflow Bpf = (Workflow)_serviceProxy.RetrieveMultiple(query).Entities[0]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Security Role Tip for Business Process Flows DESCRIPTION: Markdown tip explaining how to control access and permissions for business process flow instances. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/create-business-process-flow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` >[!TIP] >After you create a business process flow definition, you can control who can create, read, update, or delete the business process flow instance. For example, for service-related processes, provide full access for customer service reps to change the business process flow instance, but provide read-only access for sales reps to monitor post-sales activities for their customers. To set security for a business process flow definition that you create, select **Enable Security Roles** on the action bar. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Summary Header Metrics Table DESCRIPTION: Markdown table defining metrics available in the summary header, including edge counts, frequency statistics, and duration measurements. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/edge-statistics.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Metric | Description | |--------------------|------------------| | Edges | Total number of unique edges in the view. | | Minimum frequency | Minimal number of occurrences of an edge in a single case. | | Maximum frequency | Maximum number of occurrences of an edge in a single case. | | Median frequency | Median number of occurrences of an edge in a single case. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Web Account Manager (WAM) Fallback via Windows Registry - Registry DESCRIPTION: Enables Power Automate for desktop to use Windows Web Account Manager (WAM) as a fallback (or primary for pre-2.41 versions) sign-in method by setting 'UseMsalWindowsBroker' (DWORD) to 1 in the registry key 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop' under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. Modifying this value changes the authentication flow and may affect user login experience on legacy versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n\n[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Power Automate Desktop]\n"UseMsalWindowsBroker"=dword:00000001\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Entity Relationship Table for Visuals Data DESCRIPTION: Table defining the visual data entities that are recalculated during process model data refresh. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-fabric-semantic-model.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Entity|Description| |------|-----------| |ProcessMapMetrics|Aggregated measures for all nodes and transitions in the process model that are needed for visualization in process map custom visual. This entity combines event (node) information and edge (transition) information - to use the events or edges in your other visuals, filter by the value in `Is_Node` column. *Event level custom metrics* defined in Power Automate Process Mining desktop app will be added to this entity.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initial Condition to Check for Item Existence (Incorrect) DESCRIPTION: This Power Automate expression was initially suggested for the 'Condition' action's advanced mode. It attempts to check if the 'value' output (an array of rows) from the 'Get_rows' action is equal to the integer 0. This is not the correct way to check if an array is empty in Power Automate. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/odata-filters.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Expression Language CODE: ``` @equals(body('Get_rows')?['value'], 0) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restricting Microsoft Account Sign-ins via Windows Registry - Registry DESCRIPTION: Blocks users from signing in to Power Automate for desktop with Microsoft (personal) accounts by setting 'RestrictMSAAccountsSignIns' (DWORD) to 1 in the 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop' key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. This requires admin rights and direct registry editing. Setting the value to 1 disables MSA sign-ins; other values or absence of the value permits logins. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n\n[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Power Automate Desktop]\n"RestrictMSAAccountsSignIns"=dword:00000001\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Edge Extension Access Command DESCRIPTION: Command to directly access Microsoft Edge extensions page through the address bar SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/install-browser-extensions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` edge://extensions/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Email Notification for Approval Responses in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Instructions for setting up an email notification to be sent when an approver responds to an approval request. This is done by adding email actions to both branches of the approval outcome condition. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/approvals-howto.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![Send yourself an email.](media/approvals-howto/send-self.png) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Tips for Business Process Flow Designer DESCRIPTION: Markdown tips providing guidance on using the business process flow designer window effectively. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/create-business-process-flow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > [!TIP] >Here are a few tips to keep in mind as you work on your task flow in the designer window: > > * To take a snapshot of everything in the business process flow window, select **Snapshot** on the action bar. This option is useful if you want to share and get comments on the process from a team member. > * Use the mini-map to navigate quickly to different parts of the process. This feature is useful when you have a complicated process that scrolls off the screen. > * To add a description for the business process, select **Details** under the process name in the left corner of the business process flow window. You can use up to 2,000 characters. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing Parent Work Queue in Dataverse Connector (Text) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the required pattern `/entitypluralname(GUID)` for referencing a parent record (a work queue) in the Dataverse 'Add a new row' action within a Power Automate flow. This pattern is used in fields like 'Work Queue ID (work Queues)' when adding a work queue item. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/work-queues-bulk-import.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` /workqueues(44e44ea8-1af2-ed11-8848-000d3ae86f97) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Printing Images via mspaint Batch Script DESCRIPTION: This Batch script (`.bat`) uses the `mspaint` command with the `/p` flag to print a specified image file using the default printer. It then uses `taskkill` to close the Microsoft Paint process automatically. The script requires the `Image_Path` placeholder to be replaced with the actual image file path. This script is intended to be saved as a `.bat` file and executed using the "Run application" action in Power Automate. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/print-images.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: batch CODE: ``` ``` Batch script @echo off+ title Print Images rem The following command launches Microsoft Paint and prints the selected file using the default printer. mspaint /p "Image_Path" rem The following command ends the Microsoft Paint process. taskkill /IM "mspaint.exe" ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Region Selection via Windows Registry - Registry DESCRIPTION: Sets the default region for Power Automate for desktop at sign-in by writing a numeric DWORD value to the 'Cloud' key under 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop' in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. The value determines the default or forced region: 2=Global Public, 3=US Govt GCC, 4=GCC High, 5=DoD, 6=China (21Vianet). For legacy versions (pre-2.41), 0 and 1 allow more flexible user-driven selection. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n\n[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Power Automate Desktop]\n"Cloud"=dword:00000002\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Markdown Table for Input/Output Information in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This markdown table defines the required information for an expense approval scenario in Power Automate, specifying whether each piece of information is an input or output and its purpose. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/planning/define-input-output.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Information required | Input or output? | Purpose | |----------------------------|---------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------| | Employee's name | Input | To send an email if the expense is approved | | Employee's email | Input | To send an email if the expense is approved | | Employee's employee number | Input | To search in the employee management system for the banking number. | | Approval result | Output | To send an email if the expense is approved | | Approver's name | Output | To send an email if the expense is approved | | Approver's email | Output | To send an email if the expense is approved | | Approval date and time | Output | To send an email if the expense is approved | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Table - Process Data Entity Definitions DESCRIPTION: Defines the core entities used in the process data structure, including Cases, Events, AttributesMetadata, MiningAttributeLabels, CustomMetricsMetadata, and Views tables SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-pbi-data-structure.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Entity|Description| |------|-----------| |Cases|List of all cases in the process. Each case contains a unique case identifier index, Case ID display, and values for each of the *case attributes*, as defined in the mapping setup step.| |Events|List of all events in the process. Each event references a case into which it belongs using `Case_ID`, has a unique event identifier index, and values for each of the *event attributes*, as defined in the mapping setup step.| |AttributesMetadata|Entity holds the definition of all case/event-level attributes as defined in the import of event log data into process model. It includes its datatype, attribute type, and attribute level being either case or event.| |MiningAttributeLabels|Holds values of available mining attributes. A process view can be set up to look at the process from different perspective based on the selected mining attribute. If no other mining attribute is available, the entity holds the values of `Activity` attribute.| |CustomMetricsMetadata|Includes the definition of custom metrics created in the Process Mining desktop app. Based on the context in which the metric is available, many entries might exist for the same custom metric, having a different `Type`. It also includes the custom metric result data type that can be used for conversion or formatting of the values.| |Views|List of available (published) views created in the Power Automate desktop app. Only public process views are published to the data set. Entries can be used to filter report, report page, and visual to visualize only data from the specific process view.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying All Runs in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet shows an image of the 'All runs' section in Power Automate. It's used to guide users on how to check the run history of their flows. This format is used when an administrator manually places update files in a custom location. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/business-approvals-templates/approvals-kit-comparison.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Approach|Notes| |--------|-----| |Cloud Flow|Makers can use the out of the box Copilot features or the interactive designer to create triggers add actions and include the [approval actions](/power-automate/get-started-approvals) to build an approval decision making work flows| |Business process flows|Provide a streamlined user experience that leads people through the processes their organization defines for interactions that need to be advanced to a conclusion. Modify business process flows in a custom solution to include approvals.
More information: [Business process flows overview](/power-automate/business-process-flows-overview)| |Approvals Kit - Business Process|Provides a ready made process with a no-code templates and patterns that business users can use to define to trigger and approval workflow with advanced features listed in the feature comparison. The kit combines premade Power Apps, Power Automate and Dataverse components to offer a no-code Process Designer to manage and monitor approvals.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Trimming Whitespace in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: The TRIM function removes whitespace from both the beginning and end of a string. It takes a single string parameter and returns the trimmed string. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/string-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## TRIM([string]) Removes whitespace at the beginning and at the end of the string. **Parameters:** - **[string]** - input string Data type: STRING **Output Data Type**: STRING ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTP Response for Updating a Cloud Flow - Web API - HTTP DESCRIPTION: This HTTP response indicates successful updating of a workflow using the Web API, returning a 204 No Content status. No response body is returned, and the OData-Version header is present for protocol compliance. Used to confirm a successful update operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/manage-flows-with-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` HTTP/1.1 204 No Content\nOData-Version: 4.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: EventCode Table for FlowRun Data Incompleteness in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing various EventCode values and their reasons, indicating when FlowRun data might be incomplete. This table helps in understanding different scenarios that can lead to missing or incomplete flow run history. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/dataverse/cloud-flow-run-metadata.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |EventCode |Reason | |---------|---------|\n|isFlowRunIngestionECSDisabled|Cloud flow run history isn't being saved in Dataverse due to service configuration, so no cloud flow data can be shown. The ECS service configuration is set automatically and there's no way for an admin to change the ingestion behavior in this state.| |TtlSettingEqual0|Your current environment's TTL (time-to-live) configuration for cloud flow runs is set to not retain data. As a result, some cloud flow run history might be missing. This state occurs when [Organization.FlowRunTimeToLiveInSeconds](/power-apps/developer/data-platform/reference/entities/organization#BKMK_FlowRunTimeToLiveInSeconds) is set to zero.| |IngestionDisabledByOrgSettings|Cloud flow run history isn't being saved in Dataverse due to environments settings, so some of the run history for cloud flows might be missing. This occurrence happens when [Organization.FlowRunTimeToLiveInSeconds](/power-apps/developer/data-platform/reference/entities/organization#BKMK_FlowRunTimeToLiveInSeconds) was set to zero in the past.| |ElasticTableStorageCapacityReached|You reached your Dataverse storage capacity limit, causing a pause in cloud flow run data synchronization.| |ElasticTablePartitionLimitReached|You reached your Dataverse storage partition limit, causing a pause in cloud flow run data synchronization.| |IngestionRateDataLoss|Some of the run history for cloud flows might be missing due to high volume of runs in this environment.| |FlowRunsEventLoadingFailed|Unable to load the events for cloud flow runs in your current environment. As a result, some historical cloud flow run data might not be available.| |FlowRunsTTlSettingFailedMessage|Unable to retrieve your environment's TTL (time-to-live) setting for cloud flow runs. As a result, some historical cloud flow run data might not be available.| |ElasticTableNoRoleForUser|A user who owns one or more flows doesn't have read permissions to the FlowRun table in Dataverse, so some cloud flow run history isn't saved in Dataverse. The reason is because that user can't be set as the owner.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Error Image in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to include an image in markdown format, specifically showing a sign-in error for Power Automate desktop. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/requirements.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` :::image type="content" source="media\known-issues\pad-sign-in.png" alt-text="Screenshot of the sign-in window with error."::: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Table - Work Queue SLA Alert DESCRIPTION: Details for a recommendation that monitors work queue items approaching or breaching their SLA targets. Includes title, card details, recommendation details, type, refresh frequency, and recommended actions. Requires all flows to be reassigned or deleted first. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/privacy-dsr-delete.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` Add-PowerAppsAccount Remove-AdminFlowUserDetails -UserId {userID} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Documentation for Power Automate Desktop Flow Sharing DESCRIPTION: Structured documentation explaining the three main methods of sharing desktop flows: copying actions within subflows, direct sharing through Power Automate portal, and exporting via solutions. Includes important notes about copying parameters and size limitations. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/share-export-desktop-flows.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Share/export a desktop flow To replicate a desktop flow regardless of your account, edit it through the flow designer, and copy the actions within a subflow. The copied text can be sent directly to others users or saved to a text file for easier sharing. The receiver can paste the text to a flow designer and run it. > [!NOTE] > When copying actions, all their parameters, images, and UI elements are copied as well. Only one subflow can be copied at a time. If there are more than one subflows, repeat the procedure for each one individually or save the actions into separate text files. If you signed in with an organization premium account, you can also choose one of the following methods: 1. Share the desktop flow directly through the Power Automate portal. To share a desktop flow with other users in your organization, give them specific permissions to access the flow. Learn more about sharing flows through the Power Automate portal at [Share desktop flows](../manage.md#share-desktop-flows) and [Share desktop flows that contain connector actions](../how-to/share-desktop-flows-that-contain-connector-actions.md). 1. Export a solution that contains the desktop flow. To move a desktop flow from one environment to another, host it in a solution. For more information about importing flows into solutions and building solution-aware flows, see [Overview of solution-aware flows](../../overview-solution-flows.md). > [!NOTE] > If the solution fails to export because of its size, learn how to [Reduce the size of desktop flows in a solution](../how-to/reduce-flow-size.md). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Environment Reference Structure in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown formatted list defining the reference environments and workspaces used in the migration process, including development and test environments along with workspace definitions. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-pbi-reports-overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - **Dev environment**: Environment *from which* you want to migrate process mining artifacts. - **Test environment**: Environment *to which* you want to migrate process mining artifacts. - **WkSpace A**: Custom Power BI or Fabric workspace associated with the Dev environment *from which* you want to migrate the Power BI report. - **WkSpace B**: Custom Power BI or Fabric workspace associated with the Test environment *to which* you want to migrate the Power BI report. - **Report A**: Name of the Power BI report for the process in Dev environment. - **Report B**: Name of the Power BI report for the process in Test environment. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining UTILIZATION() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Returns the utilization of a case as a number between 0 and 1. Supported only in case context. Output is of FLOAT data type. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/automation-center-overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Visual | Description | | --- | --- | | **Recommendations** | List of automation health, compliance, best practice insights, and actionable recommendations. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Process Mining Navigation Path DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic folder structure and navigation path required to access the process mining capability within Power Automate SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-tutorial.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` title: Get started with the process mining capability description: Learn how to use the process mining capability with sample data in a tutorial. author: rosikm contributors: - rosikm - donums - v-aangie ms.subservice: process-advisor ms.topic: how-to ms.date: 02/10/2025 ms.author: michalrosik ms.reviewer: angieandrews search.audienceType: - flowmaker - enduser ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Clicking a Link or Button using JavaScript in Power Automate Desktop - JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an ExecuteScript function that programmatically clicks the first element matching the provided CSS selector on the current web page by invoking its 'click' method. It is meant to be used with Power Automate Desktop's 'Run JavaScript function on web page' action. Users must substitute 'CSS-Selector' for their specific use case. No external libraries are needed; the code assumes a valid selector and an interactive element which reacts to clicks. Input required is the selector, output is the simulated click action. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/populate-text-fields-click-links-javascript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` function ExecuteScript() { document.querySelectorAll('CSS-Selector')[0].click(); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Ordered Lists in Power Automate Approval Markdown DESCRIPTION: Creates numbered lists where items are automatically incremented. Even though each line starts with '1.', the rendered output shows sequential numbering. Third item. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Describing Get Selected Checkboxes in Window Action in Power Automate Documentation (Markdown) DESCRIPTION: Documents the 'Get selected checkboxes in window' action for Power Automate users. The Markdown describes inputs such as target UI element and operation mode, as well as expected behavior for retrieving checkbox states. This structure is informational for readers seeking details in the action reference; outputs and exceptions are described narratively. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/uiautomation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## Get selected checkboxes in window\n\nRetrieves the names of the selected checkboxes in a checkbox group or the state of a specific checkbox.\n\n### Input parameters\n\n|Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description|\n|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|\n|UI element|No|[UI element](../ui-elements.md)||The checkbox or checkbox group|\n|Operation|N/A|Get names of selected checkboxes in group, Get state of checkbox|Get names of selected checkboxes in group|Specify whether to retrieve the state of multiple selected checkboxes or just one|\n|Bring to front|N/A|Boolean value|True|Specify whether the window containing the UI element should be brought to the front during execution. If this option is disabled, the action will be executed in the background. Note that not all UI elements might be compatible with having the option disabled. Additionally, if execution of the action requires scrolling, disabling this option might not extract all elements.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Selecting Rows with Specific Value from Excel Worksheet - SQL DESCRIPTION: Performs a SQL SELECT query to retrieve only those rows from an Excel spreadsheet where a specified column matches a given value. This is useful in scenarios where the flow needs to filter data based on conditions without explicit iteration. Prerequisites include an open SQL connection with the correct worksheet and column names provided, replacing PLACEHOLDER tokens as directed. The output is a filtered result set relevant for downstream flow actions. Customized parameters include the worksheet name, column name, and lookup value. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/sql-queries-excel.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: SQL CODE: ``` SELECT * FROM [SHEET$] WHERE [COLUMN NAME] = 'VALUE' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Microsoft Docs Frontmatter Configuration DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter configuration for Microsoft Docs page defining metadata like title, description, author, and review information. Supports an optional attribute parameter. Supported in case context. Returns an INT. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## REWORKCOUNT([attributeName]) Returns the total count of all reworks (loops and self-loops) within the case. **Supported context:** case **Parameters:** - ***[attributeName]*** - Attribute to calculate repetitions. If none is entered, the default attribute is mining attribute (activity attribute), optional. Data type: STRING (only fixed string is allowed) **Output Data Type**: INT ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Analyzing Process in Power Automate Web Interface DESCRIPTION: Steps to analyze a process using the Power Automate Process Mining web interface. Shows navigation and process selection steps. In Power Automate in the left navigation pane, select **Process mining**. 2. In the **Environments** field in th titlebar, select your process mining environment with an imported process. 3. Open the imported process. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Basic Custom Action Class - Power Automate Actions SDK - C# DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the basic skeleton for defining a custom action class within a C# class library targeting Power Automate for desktop. It demonstrates using the [Action] attribute, inheriting from ActionBase, and overriding the Execute method for custom implementation. Dependencies include the Microsoft.PowerPlatform.PowerAutomate.Desktop.Actions.SDK and Attributes namespaces. The class receives execution context within Execute and throws a NotImplementedException as a placeholder. This serves as the starting point for further customization. Required .NET Framework: 4.7.2. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-custom-actions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` using System;\nusing Microsoft.PowerPlatform.PowerAutomate.Desktop.Actions.SDK;\nusing Microsoft.PowerPlatform.PowerAutomate.Desktop.Actions.SDK.Attributes;\n\nnamespace Modules.MyCustomModule\n{\n [Action(Id = \"CustomAction\")]\n public class CustomAction : ActionBase\n {\n public override void Execute(ActionContext context)\n {\n throw new NotImplementedException();\n }\n }\n}\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example SCM Portal URL Configuration for Quality Order RPA Solution DESCRIPTION: Provides an example URL format for the 'QOrder Parameter - SCM Portal URL' environment variable required by the Dynamics 365 Quality Order RPA solution. It includes a link to download a printable version of the maturity model and shows a snapshot image of the model. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/automation-coe/automation-maturity-model-details.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > [!NOTE] > You can [download a printable version](https://aka.ms/automationmaturitymodel) of the Power Platform Automation maturity model. > :::image type="content" source="media/Maturity-Snap.png" alt-text="High level snapshot of the automation maturity model - Groups goals based of the various HEAT pillars, namely Empower, Discover and Plan, Design, Build and Test, Deploy and Manage, Secure and Govern, and Nurture. The CMMI levels across the various phases Initial, Repeatable, Defined, Capable and Efficient in relation to the HEAT pillars are defined." ::: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Describing Get Details of a UI Element in Window Action in Power Automate Documentation (Markdown) DESCRIPTION: Documents the 'Get details of a UI element in window' action, providing parameter definitions, produced variables, and exceptions for Power Automate UI automation. This Markdown snippet is intended to serve as part of the action reference in technical documentation. No executable code is present; tables detail expected UI element attributes and outputs. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/uiautomation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## Get details of a UI element in window\n\nGets the value of a UI element's attribute in a window.\n\n### Input parameters\n\n|Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description|\n|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|\n|UI element|No|[UI element](../ui-elements.md)||The UI element to get details from|\n|Attribute name|Yes|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|Own Text|The attribute whose value will be retrieved|\n|Bring to front|N/A|Boolean value|True|Specify whether the window containing the UI element will be brought to the front during execution. If this option is disabled, the action is executed in the background. Note that not all UI elements are compatible with having the option disabled. Additionally, if execution of the action requires scrolling, disabling this option might not extract all elements.|\n\n### Variables produced\n\n|Argument|Type|Description|\n|-----|-----|-----|\n|AttributeValue|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|The value of the UI element's text|\n\n### Exceptions\n\n|Exception|Description|\n|-----|-----|\n|Failed to retrieve attribute of UI element|Indicates a problem retrieving the UI element's attribute| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing Power Automate Connection Creation Error Response DESCRIPTION: Shows the JSON structure of an error response when creating a Power Automate connection fails. If you try to import the RPA in a Day solution without first initializing the **Processes** section of the process mining capability, you see only a couple of recordings in the imported solution. > > You can see some of the existing recordings under **Recordings**. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encrypt File Contents with AES in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This action encrypts the contents of a file using AES encryption with specified parameters. It supports various encoding formats, key sizes, and optional salt and initialization vector usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/cryptography.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## Encrypt from file with AES Encrypt the contents of a file with AES, using a key and a specified encoding format. ### Input parameters |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Encoding|N/A|System default, ASCII, Unicode, Big-endian Unicode, UTF-8|Unicode|The encoding of the file to encrypt| |File to encrypt|No|[File](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)||The text file that stores the contents to encrypt| |Encryption key|No|Direct encrypted input or [Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The encryption key to use| |Padding|N/A|None, PKCS7, Zeros, ANSIX923, ISO10126|PKCS7|The padding to use for the selected encryption algorithm| |Key size|N/A|128 bits, 192 bits, 256 bits|256 bits|The size of the key in bits to use for the encryption| |Use salt|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|False|Specifies whether to use salt for encryption. When this option is enabled, the randomly generated salt becomes an output in the form of a base64 string.| |Use initialization vector|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|False|Specifies whether to use an initialization vector. When this option is enabled, the randomly generated initialization vector becomes an output in the form of a base64 string| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Trigger Conditions in Classic Power Automate Designer DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet shows an image of the trigger conditions in Power Automate's classic designer. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/automation-kit/setup/setup-checklist.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` **Total Cost per Year** = Cost to complete (per Year) + cost to remediate (per year) **Cost to Complete (per Year)**: ((((FTE Cost/60) x # of FTEs to process) x time to process (mins)) x frequency) **Cost to Remediate (per Year)**: (((Frequency x (Error Rate/100)) x Time to Fix (mins)) x FTE Cost/60) x # of FTEs to Fix)) **Full Formula**: ((((FTE Cost/60) x # of FTEs to Process) x Time to Process (mins)) x Frequency) + (((Frequency x (Error Rate/100)) x Time to Fix (mins)) x FTE Cost/60) x # of FTEs to Fix)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Embedding Recorder Launch Screenshot in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Embeds an image illustrating the 'Launching the recorder' screen using a Markdown directive specific to the documentation platform. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/automation-kit/setup/setup-checklist.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | **Cost element** | **Calculation** | |----------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | Cost to Complete (per Year) | \$12,550 (((FTE Cost/60) x # of FTEs to Process) x Time to Process) x Frequency | | Cost to Remediate (per Year) | \$522.92 ((Frequency x (Error Rate/100)) x Time to Fix (mins)) x ((FTE Cost/60) x # of FTEs to Fix) | | Cost to Remediate (per Instance) | \$20.83 (Cost to Remediate (per Year) / (Frequency x (Error Rate/100)) | | Total Cost per Year | \$13,072.92 (Cost to Complete (per Year) + Cost to Remediate (per Year) | | Total Cost per Month | \$1,089.41 (Cost to Complete per Year / 12) | | Cost per Instance | \$52.08 (Cost to Complete per Year / Frequency) | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: FetchXML Query for Flow Success/Failure Distribution DESCRIPTION: A FetchXML query that aggregates flow session data to show the distribution of failed versus succeeded flows for the last month.
