It's used to help users identify premium connectors which may require additional licensing. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/triggers-troubleshoot.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` :::image type="content" source="./media/triggers-introduction/premium-connector.png" alt-text="Screenshot of a premium connector."::: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: PowerShell Script for Creating Cabinet Files DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive PowerShell script for packaging DLL files into a cabinet (.cab) file. The script takes source directory, output directory, and cabinet filename as parameters, and uses the makecab.exe utility to create the cabinet file. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-custom-actions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: PowerShell CODE: ``` param( [ValidateScript({Test-Path $_ -PathType Container})] [string] $sourceDir, [ValidateScript({Test-Path $_ -PathType Container})] [string] $cabOutputDir, [string] $cabFilename ) $ddf = ".OPTION EXPLICIT .Set CabinetName1=$cabFilename .Set DiskDirectory1=$cabOutputDir .Set CompressionType=LZX .Set Cabinet=on .Set Compress=on .Set CabinetFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderSizeThreshold=0 .Set MaxCabinetSize=0 .Set MaxDiskFileCount=0 .Set MaxDiskSize=0 " $ddfpath = ($env:TEMP + "\customModule.ddf") $sourceDirLength = $sourceDir.Length; $ddf += (Get-ChildItem $sourceDir -Filter "*.dll" | Where-Object { (!$_.PSIsContainer) -and ($_.Name -ne "Microsoft.PowerPlatform.PowerAutomate.Desktop.Actions.SDK.dll") } | Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName | ForEach-Object { '"' + $_ + '" "' + ($_.Substring($sourceDirLength)) + '"' }) -join "`r`n" $ddf | Out-File -Encoding UTF8 $ddfpath makecab.exe /F $ddfpath Remove-Item $ddfpath ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Waiting for Window Content in Power Automate Desktop DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the 'Wait for window content' action to ensure that a specific UI element is visible before proceeding with the flow. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/creating-SAP-desktop-flow-action-based-GUI.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Desktop CODE: ``` Wait for window content UI element: Employee id ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Frontmatter Configuration DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter configuration for the documentation page including metadata like title, description, authors and dates SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-files-fabric-onelake.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- title: Ingest files from Fabric OneLake (preview) description: Learn how to store and read event log files directly from Fabric OneLake. author: rosikm contributors: - rosikm - v-aangie ms.subservice: process-advisor ms.topic: conceptual ms.date: 01/17/2025 ms.custom: bap-template ms.author: michalrosik ms.reviewer: angieandrews --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loop Detection Example - ALL Function DESCRIPTION: Evaluates whether all elements in a context meet a specified condition. Used in case metrics and overview statistics. This expression subtracts 1 from the total row count (`DataFromWebPage.RowsCount`) and is used as the 'End to' value in the 'Loop' action to ensure the loop iterates through all extracted items. Supported in event context. Takes a condition parameter and returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISPARALLELWITH([condition]) Returns TRUE if the event occurred in parallel with another event which fullfilla given condition, otherwise FALSE. **Supported context:** event **Parameters:** - ***[condition]*** - condition under which is parallelism accepted Data type: BOOLEAN **Output Data Type**: BOOL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Power Automate License Status Using Keyboard Shortcut DESCRIPTION: Method to check current Power Automate license status using a keyboard shortcut combination. Users can press Ctrl+Alt+A in Power Automate to view their license status, as there is no direct UI option available. Used for case-level aggregation. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/custom-metrics-advanced-examples.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: process-mining-expression CODE: ``` COUNTIF(Edge(), STARTACTIVITY() = "C" AND ENDACTIVITY() = "C") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Formatting Date Trigger Input using Power Automate Expression DESCRIPTION: This Power Automate expression utilizes the `formatDateTime` function to convert a date value received from the flow's trigger (`triggerBody()['date']`) into a specific string format ('dd.MM.yyyy'). This format, representing day.month.year (e.g., 13.10.2020), is specified to match the requirements of the target SAP system or the desktop flow interacting with SAP. The expression ensures date consistency when passing data between the cloud flow and the desktop flow. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/creating-cloud-flow-to-update-address.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Expression Language CODE: ``` formatDateTime(triggerBody()\['date'\]\,'dd.MM.yyyy') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Image Reference Structure DESCRIPTION: Markdown syntax for displaying process mining interface images with alt text SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/task-mining-tutorial.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` :::image type="content" source="media/task-mining-tutorial/analytics-layout.png" alt-text="Screenshot of the Analytics screen."::: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: STATS Function Syntax DESCRIPTION: Function signature for calculating process statistics with two required parameters: Aggregate for specifying calculation method and Type for selecting statistics category. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-copilot-in-ingestion.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. Sign in to [Power Automate](https://powerautomate.com). 2. Select **Process mining** > **Start here** (under **Create new process**). 3. In the **Process name** field, enter a name for your process. 4. Under the **Data source** heading, select **Azure Data Lake (preview)**. 5. Select **Continue**. 6. Complete the steps in the **Connection setup** screens for the Azure Data Lake container. 7. Select **Next**. 8. Select the folder or file you're interested in analyzing and Copilot identifies the process. 9. Confirm that it's the process you're interested in analyzing by selecting **Confirm process** > **Next**. 10. In the mapping screen, Copilot offers an automapping suggestion that you can review and choose to map your data to. 11. Once you've reviewed the automapping, you can save and analyze your process. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Get Clipboard Text Action Parameters DESCRIPTION: Parameter table defining the output variable produced by the Get Clipboard Text action. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/pdf.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description|\n|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|\n|PDF file|No|[File](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)||The PDF file to extract pages from. Enter a file path, a variable containing a file or a text path|\n|Password|Yes|Direct encrypted input or [Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The password of the PDF file. In addition to binding the primary table row ('bpf_accountid') and the desired active stage ('activestageid'), it's necessary to provide the 'traversedpath' parameter. This parameter is a comma-separated string of stage IDs representing the stages visited up to and including the specified active stage. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/business-process-flows-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` POST [Organization URI]/api/data/v9.0/new_mycustombpfs HTTP/1.1 Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8 OData-MaxVersion: 4.0 OData-Version: 4.0 Accept: application/json { "bpf_accountid@odata.bind": "/accounts(679b2464-71b5-e711-80f5-00155d513100)", "activestageid@odata.bind": "/processstages(19a11fc0-3398-4214-8522-cb2a97f66e4b)", "traversedpath":"9a9185f5-b75b-4bbb-9c2b-a6626683b99b,19a11fc0-3398-4214-8522-cb2a97f66e4b" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching SAP GUI via sapshcut.exe Command Line Arguments DESCRIPTION: These command line arguments are used with the 'sapshcut.exe' executable within a Power Automate Desktop 'Run application' action to start an SAP GUI session. The arguments specify the target system, client, user, and password using input variables defined within the flow (%SAPSystemId%, %SAPClient%, %SAPUser%, %SAPPassword%) and instruct the application to start maximized (-maxgui). SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/creating-SAP-desktop-flow-vbscript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: command-line CODE: ``` start -system=%SAPSystemId% -client=%SAPClient% -user=%SAPUser% -pw=%SAPPassword% -maxgui ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using MAXIF for Conditional Maximum Aggregation in Power Automate Expressions (Pseudo-Expression Language) DESCRIPTION: Describes MAXIF, which fetches the maximum value conforming to a boolean condition within a grouped context. Parameters are [context], [condition] (boolean), [value] (metric/expression), and [default] (fallback when none match). Returns float, time, or related types. Used for filtered 'max' analytics. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/aggregations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: pseudo-expression CODE: ``` MAXIF([context],[condition],[value],[default]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Write XML to File in Power Automate Desktop Flows DESCRIPTION: This action writes the contents of an XML node variable to a file. It allows specification of encoding, formatting options, and indentation levels for the output file. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/xml.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: XML CODE: ``` |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |File path|No|[File](../variable-data-types.md#files-and-folders)||The file to write the XML document into| |XML to write|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The XML node or document to write into the file| |Encoding|N/A|System default, ASCII, Unicode, Unicode big endian, UTF-8|System default|The encoding used for the specified file| |Format XML|N/A|[Boolean value](../variable-data-types.md#boolean-value)|True|Specifies whether to format the XML| |Indentation per level|Yes|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)|2|Specifies by how many spaces to indent each level of the XML| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining ISSTUCK() Operation in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: Checks if a case is categorized as stuck according to the Process Context - Case Categorization. Supported in case context. Returns a BOOL. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/statistical-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## ISSTUCK() Returns true when the case is categorized as stuck (as defined in Process Context – Case Categorization). **Supported context:** case **Output Data Type**: BOOL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Power Automate OneDrive Trigger DESCRIPTION: Sets up the initial trigger for the Power Automate flow. This trigger activates the flow whenever a new file is added to the specified 'Finished Documents' folder within OneDrive for Business. It requires a connection to OneDrive for Business. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/includes/learning-create-pdf.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Power Automate CODE: ``` Trigger: OneDrive for Business - When a file is created Folder: /Finished Documents ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Counting Edges Per Attribute in Metric Editor - Pseudo-Code/Formulas DESCRIPTION: Illustrates calculating the total count for edges in the process map, with aggregation and functions that apply only to edge context. This formula is meant for custom metrics for edges, excludes event-level attribute value access. Input is edge data; output is the count of edges per attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/requirements-for-application.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: pseudo-code CODE: ``` Count(EdgesPerAttribute) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Proxy Server Settings via Windows Registry - Registry DESCRIPTION: Overrides the default Windows proxy settings for Power Automate for desktop by specifying the 'ProxyServer' (String) under 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop' in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. Set to a proxy address and port (e.g. 'https://myproxy.com:3128'). As of version 2.45, preferred configuration is via the product's proxy configuration files rather than the registry. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n\n[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Power Automate Desktop]\n"ProxyServer"="https://myproxy.com:3128"\n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Event Grid Trigger for Key Vault Secret Updates in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This configuration defines the Event Grid trigger settings within a Power Automate cloud flow. It specifies listening for the 'SecretNewVersionCreated' event from a specific Azure Key Vault within a subscription to initiate the flow when a secret is updated. This trigger is part of a deprecated mechanism for updating credentials. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/create-AzureKeyVault-credential.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 1. Trigger: When a resource event occurs (Event Grid) - Resource type: **Microsoft.KeyVault.vaults** - Resource name: Provide the name of the key vault. - Subscription: Provide the name of the subscription. - Event type: **Microsoft.KeyVault.SecretNewVersionCreated** ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Single-Value Column Array in Power Fx (Power Automate Desktop) DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a single-value column array in Power Fx, resulting in an array of objects with a single 'Value' property. This illustrates a potential pitfall in array handling in version 2.48. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/power-fx.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: Power Fx CODE: ``` =[1, 2, 3] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring File Path for Power Automate Desktop Execution Logs DESCRIPTION: The file path where Power Automate Desktop Designer execution logs are stored on the local file system when the EnableDesignerExecutionLogs registry key is set to 1. These logs are useful for debugging and troubleshooting. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` %LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Designer\Scripts\\Runs\\Actions.log ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Events with Positive Duration (Attribute Comparison) in Process Mining Expression DESCRIPTION: This expression evaluates individual events to filter out those with non-positive duration. It compares the 'End' timestamp attribute with the 'Start' timestamp attribute for each event. The result is boolean (True/False) per event, used for filtering purposes, typically in event or case metric filters. No aggregation is performed. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/custom-metrics-advanced-examples.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Process Mining Expression CODE: ``` End() > Start() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Manifest V2 Deprecation Timeline Table DESCRIPTION: Markdown table showing the timeline and changes for Manifest V2 deprecation across Microsoft Partner Center, Chrome Web Store, Microsoft Edge, and Google Chrome platforms. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/manifest.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > | Timeframe | Microsoft Partner Center and Chrome Web Store changes | Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome changes | > |-----------|-------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------| > | July 2022 | No longer accepts new Manifest V2 extensions with visibility set as Hidden or Public. | No change | > |TBD
Google Chrome, TBD
Microsoft Edge |No longer accepts updates to existing Manifest V2 extensions. Developers can submit updates for migrating a V2 extension to V3. |Both browsers will stop running Manifest V2 extensions. Enterprises can allow Manifest V2 extensions to run on both browsers using Enterprise policies. | > |TBD
Google Chrome, TBD
Microsoft Edge |No change | Manifest V2 extensions will no longer function in both browsers even with the use of Enterprise policy. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extracting PDF Pages to New PDF File in Power Automate Desktop DESCRIPTION: This action creates a new PDF file by extracting pages from an existing PDF. It allows selection of specific pages and includes options for handling existing files with the same name. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/pdf.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## Extract PDF file pages to new PDF file You can create a new PDF file by extracting pages from an existing PDF file by using the **PDF file pages to a new PDF file** action. In the action parameters you can define the PDF file to extract the pages from, the page(s) to be extracted, the location of the new PDF file and what should happen if a file with the same name and extension already exists. Finally, under the advanced properties you can define a password in case the source PDF is protected. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Work Queue Items with FetchXML in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: Example FetchXML query that filters work queue items by name and orders results by expiration date (FEFO - First Expired, First Out). This query filters for items expiring on or before a specific date with a matching name value. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/workqueues.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Allowing Machine Registration Switching to Different Tenants in Power Automate DESCRIPTION: This registry entry enables switching machine registration to a different tenant in Power Automate. When set to 1, machine registration can be switched to another tenant. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/governance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: registry CODE: ``` HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Power Automate Desktop\Registration\AllowTenantSwitching ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Boolean to String in Power Automate Process Mining DESCRIPTION: The TOSTRING function converts a boolean value to a string. It returns "True" for true values and "False" for false values. It takes a single boolean parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/string-operations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## TOSTRING([bool]) Converts boolean to a string - "True" or "False". **Parameters:** - **[bool]** - input boolean value Data type: BOOL **Output Data Type**: STRING ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Initial UI Selector for First Link DESCRIPTION: Illustrates a typical CSS-like selector generated by Power Automate when targeting the first link (`:eq(0)`) within a list structure (e.g., an unordered list `ul` and list item `li`). This initial selector needs modification to target subsequent links dynamically within a loop. It includes an example with text, numeric, and boolean inputs. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/run-desktop-flows-url-shortcuts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` "ms-powerautomate:/console/flow/run?workflowId=[workflowId]&inputArguments={\"[External name 1]\": [Value 1],\"[External name 2]\": [Value 2]}" "ms-powerautomate:/console/flow/run?&workflowid=dfd0c814-2c30-4cd8-849d-a4b2d2f4f33b&inputArguments={\"NewInput\": \"Hello\", \"NewInput2\": 123, \"NewInput3\": true}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Access Parameters Table - Launch Access DESCRIPTION: Table showing input parameters, type definitions and descriptions for launching an Access database instance. This mode keeps the application running after the flow closes and permits user interaction alongside automation but can cause popups and errors requiring user attention.| |Make instance visible|N/A|Boolean value|True|Specify whether to make the Access window visible or hide it.| |Database password|Yes|Direct encrypted input or Text value||The encryption password of the database, if it's password-protected| |Exclusive|N/A|Boolean value|False|Specify whether to open the database in exclusive mode. When enabled, the database can't be shared with others while it's open.| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving All Instances of a Business Process Flow Table DESCRIPTION: This HTTP GET request retrieves all rows (process instances) for a specific business process flow table. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/developer/business-process-flows-code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: HTTP CODE: ``` GET [Organization URI]/api/data/v9.0/new_mycustombpfs HTTP/1.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using COUNT for Counting Items by Context in Power Automate Expressions (Pseudo-Expression Language) DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the COUNT aggregation, counting items within a specified context. The only parameter required is [context], defining the grouping of interest. Outputs an integer count. Useful for metric definitions requiring event, case, or process counts. No dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/minit/aggregations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: pseudo-expression CODE: ``` COUNT([context]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Browser Top-Left X Coordinate (Power Automate Desktop) DESCRIPTION: Retrieves the X-coordinate (horizontal position) of the top-left corner of the HTML page's display area within the browser window using a Power Automate Desktop expression. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/get-coordinates-size-web-element.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powerautomate-expressions CODE: ``` %Browser.DisplayRectangleX% ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting the Duration of the First Event in a Case using FIRSTEVENT() DESCRIPTION: Calculates the duration of the very first event within each case. This metric is applicable on the case overview statistics screen within the case context. No actual code or command is executed; it is a template showing how to shape the secret URI when configuring environment values. Replace the {Subscription ID}, {Resource Group Name}, {Key Vault Name}, and {Secret Name} tokens appropriately. This format is only necessary for automation kit satellite releases from March 2023 or earlier, since later releases do not require Azure Key Vault integration. Useful for monitoring CMK implementation progress. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/run-scheduled-tasks.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ - YYYY = four-digit year - MM = two-digit month (01-12) - DD = two-digit day of the month (01-31) - T = literal character that separates the date and time - HH = two-digit hour in 24-hour format (00-23) - MM = two-digit minute (00-59) - SS = two-digit second (00-59) - Z = literal character that indicates UTC time ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Create text with GPT Output Variables Table DESCRIPTION: Markdown table defining the output variables produced by the Create text with GPT action, including variable names, types and descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/process-mining-copilot-in-process-analytics.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. Select the process to analyze. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending Keystrokes in Power Automate Desktop for SAP GUI DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to send keystrokes in a Power Automate Desktop flow, including the use of the {Enter} command to simulate pressing the Enter key. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/guidance/rpa-sap-playbook/creating-SAP-desktop-flow-action-based-GUI.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Desktop CODE: ``` %CountryCode%{Enter} ``` LANGUAGE: Power Automate Desktop CODE: ``` {Enter} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Required SAP Tables for Accounts Payable Template DESCRIPTION: SQL table structure required for the Accounts Payable template implementation, including accounting documents and change tracking tables. It should be assigned to a column named EndTimestamp.millisecondsEpoch and uses the EndDate field as its input. Ensure your EndDate is in datetime or datetimezone format for correct results. The formula outputs the difference in milliseconds from the epoch for end event times. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/import-with-milliseconds.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Power Query CODE: ``` Duration.TotalSeconds(DateTimeZone.From([EndDate]) - #datetimezone(1970, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0)) * 1000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including Footer Banner in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This is a Microsoft Docs specific Markdown directive used to include content from another file. The expression evaluates to TRUE only if both conditions are satisfied, enabling actions within the 'If' block to run based on multiple variable states. It is typically compared against TRUE in the 'Second operand' field. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/how-to/logical-operations-conditional-statements.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Power Automate Expression CODE: ``` %A = 10 AND B = 5% ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Embedding Task Mining Overview Video in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Embeds a video player using a Markdown directive specific to the documentation platform (likely Microsoft Learn). It provides structured sections for each action, including descriptions, parameter tables, expected results, sample use cases, and limitations. Users are guided on how to join, split, parse, convert, and extract entities from text through action documentation, tables, and references, supporting implementation and understanding for both beginner and advanced users. The snippet assumes a Markdown rendering environment and references other documentation for dependencies and specific data types; no executable code is provided. SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoftdocs/power-automate-docs/blob/main/articles/desktop-flows/actions-reference/text.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Text actions Text actions enable you to handle, manipulate, and convert text values in your desktop flows. To merge a list of text values and create a single value, use the **Join text** action. The action requires you to specify the list and a delimiter. To split a single text value into a list, deploy the **Split text** action, and specify the text value and the delimiters to separate the list items. To replace a subtext in a text, use the **Replace text** action. The following example replaces the text **Product Characteristics** with **Characteristics**. ![Screenshot of the Replace text action.](media/text/replace-text-example.png) Search a text value inside another text with the **Parse text** action. Some text actions allow you to use regular expressions. For example, you can enable **Is regular expression** in the **Parse text** action to search for a text specified by a regular expression. To find more information about regular expressions, go to [Regular Expression Language - Quick Reference](/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expression-language-quick-reference). Additionally, you can disable **First occurrence only** to make the action return a list with the positions of all the matched texts. The following example searches all the words in **Items detected in Stock** starting with a capital letter. The produced list named **Matches** stores the values **Items** and **Stock**. The **Positions** list stores the positions in which the values were found (1 and 18). ![Screenshot of the Parse text action.](media/text/parse-text-example.png) Besides searching in texts, Power Automate enables you to crop text values from texts using the **Crop text** action. You can define the text to crop using flags that are the first occurring given character or string markers. You can crop values before, after, or between the specified text flag(s). The **CroppedText** variable stores the cropped text, while you can use the **IsFlagFound** variable to check if the action found the set flags. ![Screenshot of the Crop text action.](media/text/crop-text-example.png) To ensure that numbers are stored as numerical values, use the **Convert text to number** action. To perform the reverse conversion, use **Convert number to text**. Similarly, you can use the **Convert text to datetime** and **Convert datetime to text** actions to ensure that dates are correctly formatted. ## Use the Recognize entities in text action Desktop flows enable you to extract various entities from texts in natural language, such as numbers, dates, and measurement units, through the **Recognize entities in text** action. ![Screenshot of the Recognize entities in text action](media/text/recognize-entities-text-action.png) The **Recognize entities in text** action gets a text or a variable containing text and returns a data table containing the results. Each entity returns different results based on its structure, but all the data tables contain an **Original text** field that stores the entity part of the input text. The following table displays various examples of entities that the **Recognize entities in text** action can recognize. |Entity |Input text |Returned values | |------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |Date time |I'll go back 04th Jan 2019 |**Value:** 1/4/2019 12:00:00 AM
**Original text:** 04th Jan 2019 | |Date time |Schedule a meeting tonight at 7pm |**Value:** 9/30/2021 7:00:00 PM
**Original text:** tonight at 7pm | |Dimension |You weight 200 lbs |**Value:** 200
**Unit:** Pound
**Original text:** 200 lbs | |Dimension |Α twister roared through an area about 10 miles long there |**Value:** 10
**Unit:** Mile
**Original text:** ten miles | |Temperature |The temperature outside is 40 deg celsius |**Value:** 40
**Unit:** C
**Original text:** 40 deg celsius | |Currency |Net interest income sank 27 percent in the quarter to /$ 254 million |**Value:** 254000000
**Unit:** Dollar
**Original text:** $ 254 million | |Number range|This number is larger than 20 and less or equal than 35 |**From:** 20
**To:** 35
**Original text:** larger than 20 and less or equal than 35 | |Number range|From 5 to 10 |**From:** 5
**To:** 10
**Original text:** From 5 to 10 | |Number range|Less than 4.565 |**From:** 0
**To:** 4.565
**Original text:** Less than 4.565 | |Number |A dozen |**Value:** 12
**Original text:** A dozen | |Number |Two thirds |**Value:** 0.666666666666667
**Original text:** Two thirds | |Ordinal |I like the first two books |**Value:** 1
**Original text:** first | |Ordinal |Eleventh |**Value:** 11
**Original text:** Eleventh | |Percentage |100 percent |**Value:** 100
**Original text:** 100 percent | |Phone number|Tel: +1 209-555-0100 |**Value:** +1 209-555-0100
**Original text:** +1 209-555-0100 | |Email |felix@contoso.com |**Value:** felix@contoso.com
**Original text:** felix@contoso.com | |IP address |My PC IP address is 1.1.1.1 |**Value:** 1.1.1.1
**Original text:** 1.1.1.1 | |Mention |@Alice |**Value:** @Alice
**Original text:** @Alice | |Hashtag |#News |**Value:** #News
**Original text:** #News | |URL |www.microsoft.com |**Value:** www.microsoft.com
**Original text:** www.microsoft.com | |GUID |123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000 |**Value:** 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000
**Original text:** 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000 | |Quoted text |Enter the value in the "value" field |**Value:** "value"
**Original text:** "value" | >[!NOTE] > The **Recognize entities in text** action supports 14 different languages. However, some entities may not be available for specific languages. To find more information about language restrictions, go to [Microsoft Recognizers Text - Supported entities across cultures](https://github.com/microsoft/Recognizers-Text#supported-entities-across-cultures). ## Append line to text Appends a new line of text to a text value. ### Input parameters |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Original text|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The original text| |Line to append|Yes|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The text to add on as a new line| ### Variables produced |Argument|Type|Description| |-----|-----|-----| |Result|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|The new text| ### Exceptions This action doesn't include any exceptions. ## Get subtext Retrieve a subtext from a text value. ### Input parameters |Argument|Optional|Accepts|Default Value|Description| |-----|-----|-----|-----|-----| |Original text|No|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)||The text to retrieve a section of text from| |Start index|N/A|Start of text, Character position|Character position|Specify how to find the starting point for text retrieval| |Character position|No|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)||The position of the first character to retrieve. This value is a zero-based index, counting from zero for the first character| |Length|N/A|End of text, Number of chars|Number of chars|Specify whether the subtext continues to the end of the text, or includes only a certain number of characters| |Number of chars|No|[Numeric value](../variable-data-types.md#numeric-value)||The number of characters to retrieve| ### Variables produced |Argument|Type|Description| |-----|-----|-----| |Subtext|[Text value](../variable-data-types.md#text-value)|The retrieved subtext| ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Environment Variables Configuration Table DESCRIPTION: Table defining the required environment variables for the Dynamics 365 RPA solution configuration, including company name, site URL, and user credentials.
